column5: "Annexed to the U.S.A. in 1898, Hawaii is nestled in the waters of the Pacific, a little drop of heaven, often visited on Valentines.. (from Ihatobu with the date corrected. Hawaii became a state in 1959)...　RTK2:　テン　添付　てんぷ(appendix)."

column4: "You swear you'll be in love forever, but invariably there comes a time when your heart is divided."
column5: "For this kanji I invariably got the stroke order wrong. I nearly lost heart, but decided to stick (pun) to it. Then I noticed the order is 1) katakana ソ (altered slightly); 2) fishhook; 3) two drops. Now I invariably get it right."

column4: Anything full of water will invariably begin to ooze.
column5: "When you pierce a heart with a stake, it invariably oozes blood."

column4: "This pictograph actually really works if you look at it as a hand with fingers spread and middle finger pointing down. see the very top stroke as the edge of a shirt cuff, and it will all come together."
column5: A hand is useful for 千一(1001) things.

column4: "It's a hot day of summer with a clear sky, you're sitting outside a cafe (or maybe on a reclining chair in the garden), and you watch over the kids with a hand covering your eyes from the sunlight (next time, don't forget the sunglasses)."
column5: "Think of the monster from Pan's Labrynth, that watched over the poor girl with eyes in the palm of his hands."

column4: "If you grind the hemp without a stone but use your hand instead it will chafe. (Image: ""Robin, why are your hands all chafed?"" 'Uh... (I've been grinding hemp all day)')."
column5: "When the feds came to bust your little hemp grove, you jumped out the back side of the cave and tried to repel down with a hemp rope. Unfortunately, the rope chafed your hands and you fell .. ouch!"

column4: "Someone with a huge EGO is too good for any romantic partner and as such has nothing but personal ""hand fiestas"" with himself every night."
column5: Did you hear about the guy who had such a big EGO that he threw a fiesta for his left hand?

column4: "Righteous Christians are sheep with egos (reworked from raulir, fixes word order to match radical order)."
column5: "On the other hand, Woman tend to have too much self-righteousness to allow any man to touch their wooly black sheep this results in similar hand fiestas."

column4: Careful deliberation produces words of righteousness.
column5: "At the worst of times, a jury's deliberation descends into a war of words between competing self-righteous, power-tripping bastards."

column4: A cow that is righteous sacrifices her milk for the human race.
column5: "Cows are truly righteous animals. They SACRIFICE their milk so that we can have some. And if they don't have any left, they give a sheep a hand fiesta (good lord this is going too far) and give us that instead. What righteous cows."

column4: "I like to RUB my FINGERS over my EXTREMITIES ....like my extremity-ly long, umm, hair.... This has been edited in response to being reported ...you can change ""hair"" to whatever extremity-ly long body part you like."
column5: "When you're cold, your RUB your FINGERS over your EXTREMITIES vigorously to warm up a bit. I'd still rather go in for a warm fire and some hot cocoa, though."

column4: "When embracing someone, wrap your fingers around her butt for added effect. You may think of ""bound with snakes"" as a description of the fingers slithering around the buttocks, if you want a particularly graphic image."
column5: "Here, I'm picturing that scene from ET (the extra terrestrial), where ET hugs Elliot before leaving. You see that EMBRACE is ET's long FINGERS that WRAP around Elliot."

column4: "Ok, this is a little wierd, but i took this back to the kanji for pagoda (#254). I think it helps simplify the image, and also helps anchor the pagoda kanji in memory better as an added bonus. say this aloud once, and i think it will bring out a vivid image very quickly: ""Now boarding the pagoda ride. Please keep your fingers inside at all times...""."
column5: When you board the ship on the way out from Hawaii a beautiful crewmember takes her fingers and fits a lei around you ....a lei is flowers fitted together with your fingers.

column4: You can extract her juices by inserting a few fingers.
column5: "The mafia want to extract information from you. You don't say a word, so out comes the knife. They cut of your fingers until you only have a few left and then you speak."

column4: "Gandalf confronts the evil beast, shouting ""you shall not pass!"". He holds up a single finger and sends forth a whirlwind."
column5: Imagine a thumb war. A confrontation of fingers in a whirlwind.

column4: "Think of the two most famous critics, Ebert and Roeper. On their show, they compare thumbs (which are technically fingers) with each other before dispensing criticism."
column5: My criticism earned me the FINGER when I COMPARED her cooking to my mother's.

column4: "A Geisha beckons you with her index finger, and as you approach she runs her fingers all over her body in an attempt to seduce you. Keyword meaning : “invite”."
column5: "I bet you all know the Maneki Neko, or beckoning cat, who with its raised fingers tries to seduce all good things (success, happiness and harmony) to its owner."

column4: "A huge index finger coming down from the sky is kicking boulders of rock, clearing the land. Maybe it's the finger of God preparing a place for his little people to live."
column5: "I imagine clearing the land in order to set up your tent after a long day of backpacking. Using your fingers, you pick up all of the rocks and get them out of the way so that you can get a comfortable night sleep. If you don't clear the land you can just picture the rock sticking into your back as you toss and turn all night long."

column4: "(Image: the most snooty prim and proper English Lord with white gloves clapping only with his fingers. ""Oh bravo old chap. Bravo..."")."
column5: "I clapped so hard, my fingers became white."

column4: "You're using a hammer to drive a nail into a plank, but you miss and strike your fingers, ouch ! PS: the character does not mean ""to go on strike"", it will be very helpful in the long run to create images that convey the proper sense of the character!"
column5: My teacher used to strike my fingers with a street sign.

column4: "You approach the thief from behind, stick your finger at his back to fake a gun, and say the phrase ""You're under arrest""."
column5: Giving the police the finger and a colorful phrase is a surefire way to get arrested.

column4: Someone stuck their fingers in my cottage cheese! I'm going to have to discard the lot!
column5: "The wicked witch from Hansel and Gretel only likes the meaty parts of kids. Outside her candy cottage, you can see a pile of discarded fingers."

column4: "Wrap your FINGERS around someone's MOUTH to keep them quiet, then put the KNIFE to their throat to ensure their cooperation. This is the best way to KIDNAP someone."
column5: "After you beckon (#650) someone by seducing them, you kidnap them and hang them upside down (the reversed positions of seduce)."

column4: "My grandma always pinched me with her fingers when i was playing with her antiques. Imagine her fingers, also quite antique, thin, bony and hard, pinching at your hand. ""Keep your fingers away from my antiques!!""."
column5: >_< Don't you hate when your aunt (who is an antique) PINCHES your cheeks with her antique fingers?

column4: "Here comes a new challenge, try to kill Bowser, the giant Turtle using jut on finger."
column5: "You are sure to take a challenge because your victory was portended. So you stand self-confident before your foe, point a finger at him and say ""I will prevail, as was long portended!""."

column4: Finger lickin' delicious.
column5: "I remember this not as finger which has too many uses elsewhere but as ""fingering"" then its easy: fingering some delicious..."

column4: "At the BUDDHIST TEMPLE you'll see wonderous things, such as the priest that can HOLD himself upside down with just a FINGER."
column5: "In Kyaiktiyo, there is rocking stone which sits on the edge of a cliff, and there is a Buddhist temple built on the top of it. You can rock the stone by pushing it with your finger, but it still holds in place. It's true, see here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyaiktiyo."

column4: Teacher was always telling us to fasten our lips by pulling a zipper shut with our fingers. It always frightened me because I imagined getting my tongue stuck in the zipper.
column5: "On the plane, you refuse to FASTEN your seatbelt and even go so far as to give the stewardess the finger and stick out your tongue at her. The crew comes and pins you down and forces you to FASTEN it."

column4: "A military leader in his chariot is brandishing his finger at the enemy, crying ""chaaaaaaaaarrrgggeeee!""."
column5: "Think of the movie Gladiator but instead Maximus is brandishing a giant foam brand name (nike, rebok, adidas, whatever) finger like you see at a baseball game. He's riding in a chariot using the foam finger to kill his enemy."

column4: "In mathematics, a conjecture is a mathematical statement which has been proposed as a true statement, but which no one has yet been able to prove or disprove. Have you heard of the Finger-Turkey conjecture ? It states that if turkeys had fingers, they would be able to count. Be sure to imagine a turkey with fingers at the tip of its wings, counting from one to ten."
column5: "In the midst of conjecture on whether it was done or not, mom stuck her fingers in the turkey to check."

column4: My piggy bank is so heavy that I cannot HOIST it using just my fingers.
column5: "Picture a major robbery where some dudes are breaking into a bank to steal their money. They get their man in the vault through the ceiling - now he's hanging from a rope a few feet from the ground (like in the movies, dodging laser beams). He reports back that he has found the loot, and its all in a large piggy bank in the center of the vault. The alarm sounds and he's got to think fast. He jams the four fingers of his right hand in the piggy bank slot and tells his team to hoist him up, he's got the loot!"

column4: "When a man PROPOSES to a lady, he takes her FINGER and places the ring on it JUST SO, and the moment sweeps her away."
column5: "I tried to propose to my girlfriend, but the ring was too small to fit her finger. Instead of saying yes, she just uttered an annoyed sigh. So I rushed to the jeweler where he made it bigger. But now it was too big, so I rushed back to make it smaller. This spiel kept going on until the ring was finally just so. Her eyes lit up and she said yes."

column4: "Boss yells, ""Who damaged the Xerox machine?!"" fingers of employees point at one another."
column5: "If you finger your employee, you risk incurring many damages from a possible sexual harassment lawsuit."

column4: I tried to PICK UP the bowling ball...but my FINGERS didn't FIT in the holes.
column5: Try PICKING UP a girl by trying to FIT your FINGER in you know what... let me know how that works.

column4: "One of Hercules' labors was to hold the world in his fingers for Atlas and not move until nightbreak, shouldering the considerable burden."
column5: One of the classic stories of shouldering a heavy burden is that of the kid who had to stick his finger on a dam until nightbreak to prevent it from breaking down.

column4: "When rockclimbing, when your weight disposes of the valuble foothold, all that's left is your fingers keeping you from death. Meanwhile, your walking legs are left dangling in the wind."
column5: "Once you have a good foothold, you can dispose of your fingerhold."

column4: "A sketch is a seedling (#234) of things to come. Before the assault, the sergeant draws a sketch of the attack with his fingers in the sand."
column5: "I'm bad at drawing, so when I try to sketch the kanji for cat, you can sort of recognize it, but I don't get the curve of the ""wild dogs"" just right."

column4: "Tip: goods + wood/tree : This combination of primitives appears four times in Heisig, so it's worthwhile giving it a name. I suggest ""furniture"" (a common type of wooden goods). REF: parch (#215) , maneuver (FRAME 671), winding (#1369), seaweed (#2035). Story: Using just a finger you are trying to maneuver your furniture round your room."
column5: Luke skywalker points his fingers and uses the force to maneuver the goods through the tree branches and up over the tree.

column4: "A pervert meets a woman. The pervert tries to touch the women with his lustful fingers. The woman takes a vase, lifts it over her head and smashes it on the pervert's head..."
column5: CHIKAN!! These are the perverts who use their fingers to touch standing women on crowded trains.

column4: "A muchacho puts up a notice that says “NO FINGER SNAPPING ALLOWED. MUCHACHOS ON SIESTA”. The muchachos are sleeping soundly, completely oblivious to the sound of dogs barking, guitar playing and even gun shots. Now imagine one tourist passing by and snapping his fingers and waking up all the muchachos at once."
column5: "Just as I was finished putting up a ""no siestas"" notice on my property, a muchacho gave me the finger, sat down, and promptly fell asleep."

column4: "Think RPG. The wizard points his finger to the guard and the ivy he has just animated with his magic wand climbs down the wall to hang the poor guy, opening the way for the adventurers into the dungeon."
column5: "3 ways you could hang something: 1) the normal way, with your finger putting something on a hook or whatever, 2) hanging from a vine the natural way, or 3) by means of the magic of the wand."

column4: My stones are so huge that it takes two hands to polish them!
column5: You use two hands to polish a stone: one to hold it and the other to rub it.

column4: "Two hands, fiesta.....when moses received the ten commandments with two hands, he went back down the mountain and threw a fiesta with the jews, celebrating the arrival of the commandments."
column5: "When Moses returned with the commandments in his hands he saw that his people were throwing a fiesta. At first he was excited. Then he looked around and got pissed. ""Awww, c'mon guys. Golden idols? Really?""."

column4: "The ten commandments were heavy. So to help carry them, Moses made a wooden contraption; the ark of the covenant."
column5: Think of a complex wooden contraption capable of giving you a two-handed fiesta.

column4: An Egyptian embalmer reaching both hands into the dead pharaoh's nose and yanking out handfuls of brain.
column5: I sneezed so hard that through my NOSE I blew out my BRAINS into BOTH HANDS.

column4: This kanji is for severe punishment. A man has his shackled hands placed on a wood block and they're chopped off with a saber. No more stealing bread in the Middle East...
column5: In Arab countries they punish theives by cutting off BOTH HANDS with a SABRE.

column4: "A famous ninja once pressed his two hands and saber into the soil of his temple, before going onto a mission from which he never came back. Think of some sort of signature that he left behind him. The mould of his two hands and saber has since become a popular attraction in the area."
column5: As a PUNISHMENT they made me lay face down in the DIRT leaving a nice imprinted MOULD of my whole BODY.

column4: "Spinal tap: ""Every other band's amps go to ten. But you see my extra stroke of genius - these go to eleven.""."
column5: A TEN year old had a STROKE of GENIUS and wrote this joke: 何歳ですか？　　　。。。天才です！.

column4: "If you're a money genius, you can afford a lot of property."
column5: "The keyword refers to property in the sense of money or funds rather than of buildings or real estate. Keep this one distinct from frame 193 (“wealth”) and frame 473 (“assets”). Here we have a genie, gulping down oysters. Someone tries to grab an oyster and the genie puts his big arms around his oysters and states his “right of ownership” : “They're mines, my property!”."

column4: A TREE GENIUS is a LUMBER jack. Duh.
column5: "Just when the were about to turn the last tree into lumber, the Lorax (the tree-genie) jumps out and puts a stop to the whole affair."

column4: "How do you suppose they manage to cram a genie inside a bottle? Well, I suppose they put him in there while he's still a little child..."
column5: "Villagers on a little remote island one day find a bottle washed out by the sea onto the beach. After wiping the bottle and taking a closer look, they are amazed to see a (very small) child in it. The villagers suppose that the child is a genie in a bottle."

column4: Genie in the bottle does exist but you need to dig deep into the soil to find one.
column5: "You wipe the soil from the bottle, only to have a genie float out above you, saying: 'I am the genie in a bottle, what is your wish?' So now you know that they do exist."

column4: FROM a pictograph of a thumbs up. That's how it also gets the primitive meaning of fist.
column5: "Think Charlton Heston: ""From my cold, dead fists"". Speech given to the National Boxing Association, in response to stricter control on boxing gloves."

column4: "This character is the ""kei"" in ""keitai"" (cell phone), a word you will no doubt hear often in Japan, since everyone has one. Imagine you've just arrived in Japan, but don't have a cell phone yet, so instead you're carrying around a portable turkey you can hold in your fist. To dial a number, just poke it with your fingers."
column5: "Because they have no fingers, turkeys must use their fists when dialing on a portable phone."
column10: た;ず;さ;-;え;る;、;た;ず;さ;-;わ;る

column4: I like to think of this as a fist with with brass knuckles because of the extra line. An old school thug reaches out to help you up but then with his other hand ( with the brass knuckles) punches you.
column5: Reach out and fist someone (Do you see the person primitive?).

column4: "Imagine a baby reaching out and holding mom's breast as if it were bottle, and sucking on it to get some milk."
column5: An open mouth and reaching hands : a baby wants to suck at his mother's breast.

column4: "See suck (#689): if it's too big to handle, just use your fingers instead..."
column5: One of the first thing a baby can do with his hand is to reach out and grab your finger as if it was a little handle.

column4: Both a meter and a yard are about one arm-length.
column5: "This kanji reminds me of the kanji for big (I think it looks the same kinda of except for the last stroke). Maybe this works for guys, but when you were growing up you would compare ""length"" with your friends trying to show how BIG you were. You wouldn't show ""it"" but you would spread your arms out as wide as possible to exaggerate your length. Maybe even so wide that you trip (I the 3rd stroke getting pushed over)! I just find it easier to relate this to the previous kanji."

column4: I sleep in history class with my mouth tucked under my arm.
column5: "History students usually going to school with a history book tucked under their arm. But now instead of a book, you have a small talking mouth that tell you about history. ""When I was young, I used to walk 5 miles everyday.....""."

column4: One officer can change the course of history.
column5: "One officer, namely Napoleon, changed the course of history. (Thanks, ayoung24). Napoleon is also my primitive meaning."

column3: grow late;night watch;sit up late;of course
column4: "It's starting to GROW LATE, so God will take the SUN, and TUCK IT UNDER HIS ARM, and walk away. In the morning, he'll bring it back, so don't worry."
column5: "At nightbreak (#30) the sun rises above the floor, so it is logical that when it is growing late, the sun would rise to the ceiling. Time to pack up your things and take your belongings under your arm."

column4: A stiff drink on the ROCKs after it GROWS LATE is a way to unwind after a long day...
column5: "Stones are so stiff that even if you spent all day straining trying to change their shape, it would grow late far before you ever accomplished your task."

column4: "After her boyfriend's crotch has been satisfied, a woman might suggest they cuddle. The boyfriend, on the other hand, might say, ""Or again, we could fool around . . . ""."
column5: "This keyword should really be ""again"" not ""or again"" Here is some context: think of the phrase ""Jya mata"" ""じゃ又"" which is a farewell similar to ""then again"". Also ""Mata ne"" ""又ね"" and mata ashita (again tomorrow) ""又明日""。 Note this kanji is rarely used, most of the time JP people spell it out ""mata"" except for in the last example: 又明日."

column4: The animals boarding Noah's Ark all came in pairs – but Noah had to carefully check the two crotches in each pair to ensure that the animals were of different sexes and thus able to further their species after the flood.
column5: Crotch to crotch is how many pairs spend their private time together. . .

column4: "Children going around the mulberry tree singing ""This is the way we wash our crotch, wash our crotch, wash our crotch...""."
column5: "Imagine kids all over the top of a mulberry tree, sitting astride limbs so that their weight is on their crotches. (Mulberry trees have big sprawling limbs that run horizontally or at shallow angles making them easy to climb and sit in. I have an old mulberry in my yard, and my kids are in it constantly)."

column3: vessels;no. of ships;fish;birds;arrows;one of a pair
column4: "On Vessels that travel long distances, sailors often get quite lonely. They keep TURKEYS on the VESSELS, but not for use as food. The lonely sailors take turns enjoying the turkey's CROTCH."
column5: "Donald Duck is a big bird that does not wear pants. It's good to use him as a mnemonic because he is a sailor, and this kanji is used to count vessels."

column4: "Think of the flower-vessels as a the Greenpeace vessel “Arctic Sunrise”, only instead of a rainbow there is a big flower painted on the hull (this will come back in seize (#701) and harvest (#908)). Think of “flower-power” and of the “peace” in “Greenpeace” and it will make some sense hopefully. -- In this kanji, we see an inauguration speech being given before the Greenpeace vessel is set afloat and sent to safeguard our planet."
column5: "(With sarcasm) A Bush speech telling how all the US vessels are always welcomed, covered with flowers and words of gratitude for safeguarding democracy from the evil doers."

column4: "A pack of genetically-modified wild dogs is seized by a group of Greenpeace activists and taken onboard the Greenpeace vessel (the flower vessel, see safeguard (#700))."
column5: Customs just seized a crate of poppies (flowers) detected by trained wild dogs who inspected the vessel.

column4: "That GUY stole my WOMAN so I kicked him in the CROTCH. (This story helps keep the word ""GUY"" as someone you hold in contempt)."
column5: Guys only care about 2 things: women and their crotch (preferably at the same time).

column4: This woman is angry because of the guys in the previous frame who pay more attention to her crotch than her heart. I prefer to decompose the kanji in three elements here because it is easier to read like a mnemonic.
column5: WOMEN get very ANGRY over the thought that GUYS are more interested in her CROTCH than her HEART.

column4: "A good friend is always at your side. ---- I teach at a Japanese High School, and I often see chummy male students grabbing each other's crotches in a joking manner. It's still weird to me, but apparently reaching to your side and grabbing you neighbor's crotch is a great way to express friendship."
column5: "Think of a sex friend (a fuck buddy if you will). The benefit of such a relationship is that there will always be a crotch by your side. (the Japanese refer to such a friend as セフレ, just as we do)."

column4: Don't let good friends slip out between your fingers.
column5: "Imagine a cliché Hollywood situation: one person is lying on the edge of the abyss and another (presumably his friend) is hanging, only thing holding him is the grip of their hands. Then fingers slip out of the grip and he falls in said abyss."

column3: throw;discard;abandon;launch into;join;invest in;hurl;give up;sell at a loss
column4: "Well, you usually use your fingers to throw objects used as missile weapons. Easy. By the way, for those of you looking for a less anachronistic image for the missile primitive as a modern rocket, try a slingshot. it's a crotch (originally a tree branch) that sends missile projectiles flying into/like the wind. And for this present kanji, it is something you naturally use with your fingers..."
column5: "If you use the primitive ""semen"" (flying in the wind from your crotch) instead of missile then all kanjis with this primitive will hilariously create a perfect story."

column4: (Note: this kanji is more collapse/cave-in/sink (#1888) than humans drowning) A water missile? A torpedo! And when it hits it's target? The ship collapses then sinks and everyone drowns!
column5: "The submarine's hull was breached after being struck by a torpedo (""water missile""), causing the entire crew to drown."

column4: "Establishment can be attacked by words or by missiles. Writers will use words, whereas militars will use missiles."
column5: "When you attack the establishment with words, it fights back with missiles."

column4: "Your car has missles?! That beats mine, hands down."
column5: Think 3 methods of attack all combined into 1 kanji: 1. Vehicle to transport troops 2. Once troops have disembarked they have their missiles 3. If they run out of missiles they resort to hand to hand combat to beat the enemy.

column4: Samurai's husk/shell/armour is superflous to missile attacks 甲殻　卵殻　貝殻.
column5: husk or shell. Japan's recent history in a nutshell: first the samurai became superfluous and then the Americans started to throw missiles and bombs during WWII.

column4: Picture sliding down the branch of a tree (in this case a pine tree or any tree with needles) and getting a bunch of needles stuck in your crotch--ouch!!
column5: "A special branch of the military called the Needle Crotch Unit. Their only weapon is the needle embedded in their crotches, and they're quite adept at using them."

column4: "(Adapted from darg_sama's) Balancing a branch on your finger is the prototypical example of a skill that is nothing more than a skill (i.e., it is completely useless)."
column5: "I think of a guy balancing a branch on his finger, which definitely takes some minimal amount of skill."

column4: The tree's primary branch is known as the bough.
column5: "Differentiate between BOUGH and branch (#711): 'branch' is smaller, and can also refer to the branch of a store (支店), which has nothing to do with a tree. But a BOUGH is a main part of a tree, perhaps where the trunk splits into several large boughs, and so it logically utilizes the 木 radical."

column4: "The limbs that this kanji represents are parts of the body that are connected to the trunk, like the main branches to a tree (“arms and legs” is the second meaning of this kanji). In other words, limbs are ""flesh branches""."
column5: Limbs are body parts that branch off.

column4: "Suggestion: Replace ""spool"" with ""toilet paper/roll"". Reasons: (1) Toilet paper/roll usually comes on a spool. (2) Toilet paper is used to clean the soil off your crotch. Story: Just get a flower and carefully wrap some toilet paper around its stalk. Spool also appears in suspicious (#716), lightly (#717), diameter (#882), sutra (#1360)."
column5: "PRIMITIVE: soiled crotch = soiled underwear. To precent anyone from picking the beautiful flower, the gardner hung soiled underwear on the stalk."

column4: "When you're suspicious, your state of mind twists round and round like a spool of thread."
column5: Imagine a loud farting sound on The Enterprise (sorry). Everyone looks around trying to find who did it. The one looking most suspicious is Data. His soiled crotch gives him away.

column4: "Fact: this kanji is used to denote a certain class of vehicles in Japan whose engines are under a certain size (less than 750cc I think) and are called light vehicles here. Imagine a so-called light vehicle or a light-truck with a load of spools driving down a road ever so lightly, careful not to let any of the spools roll out onto the street."
column5: "I want to tread lightly on the environment.... That's why I CAR-SPOOL to work everyday.... I know, lame."

column4: Oh come on people - say what we've all been thinking: the uncle is that creepy guy towering above a little one's crotch.
column5: "Four straight kanji here with 叔 in it, so let's make one story: Your UNCLE was full of loneliness (#720) (寂), and he lived by himself. He was naturally graceful (#721) (淑) in the water, and you knew he was once on the Olympic synchronized swimming team). You knew that there was something different about him, but you joined his youth team and he watched over you carefully as coach (#719) (督). It was uncomfortable, though, how your uncle (#718) often touched you just a little above the crotch (叔) when coaching..."

column4: Creepy uncle volunteers as gymnastics coach so he can eye the team from below.
column5: "Four straight kanji here with 叔 in it, so let's make one story: Your UNCLE was full of loneliness (#720) (寂), and he lived by himself. He was naturally graceful (#721) (淑) in the water, and you knew he was once on the Olympic synchronized swimming team. You knew that there was something different about him, but you joined his youth team and he watched over you carefully as coach (#719) (督). It was uncomfortable, though, how your uncle (#718) often touched you just a little above the crotch (叔) when COACHing..."

column4: The unmarried uncle's house is the picture of lonlieness.
column5: "Four straight kanji here with 叔 in it, so let's make one story: Your UNCLE was full of loneliness (#720) (寂), and he lived by himself. He was naturally graceful (#721) (淑) in the water, and you knew he was once on the Olympic synchronized swimming team. You knew that there was something different about him, but you joined his youth team and he watched over you carefully as coach (#719) (督). It was uncomfortable, though, how your uncle (#718) often touched you just a little above the crotch (叔) when coaching..."

column4: "Uncle (the one who is lonely and coaches kids in his spare time) is actually a graceful guy once he hits the water, as he used to be part of the swimming team in his youth."
column5: "Four straight kanji here with 叔 in it, so let's make one story: Your UNCLE was full of loneliness (#720) (寂), and he lived by himself. He was naturally graceful (#721) (淑) in the water, and you knew he was once on the Olympic synchronized swimming team. You knew that there was something different about him, but you joined his youth team and he watched over you carefully as coach (#719) (督). It was uncomfortable, though, how your uncle (#718) often touched you just a little above the crotch (叔) when coaching..."

column4: "I think of an anti-hero (Dirty Harry etc.) for this primitive, whose trademark for disposing of villians is not an honorable fight, but a kick in the crotch and then a shove off a cliff (perhaps whilst the villain's back is turned)."
column5: Many cultures are so anti-sex you'd think they just want people to throw their crotches over a cliff.

column4: "As the villain (pushed off by the anti-hero) is tumbling down the slope, he activates gadget skis to escape, spraying soil everywhere as he flies down the slope."
column5: "This kanji depicts a classic enviornmental problem: erosion. Erosion occurs when all of the soil washes of the side of the cliff, eventually causing the cliff to disappear, leaving a slope (an anti- cliff if you will) in its place."

column4: "Of course, trees are anti-plank. Wouldn't you be if you were a tree?"
column5: "Trees are naturally opposed to, or anti, the making of planks."

column4: Pretty obvious: to return is to turn back on the road you're on and go the opposite way.
column5: "In ""The Return of the anti-hero"", Clint Eastwood kicks the villain in the crotch, pushes them off the cliff and onto a busy highway. A tiring movie franchise to say the least...."

column4: The goal of marketing is to get people who are naturally anti-buying to spend their shells (money).
column5: "『MARKETING: MONEY, ANTI』 The wide presence of MARKETING in our society has led people to become ANTI-MONEY."

column4: A pictograph of Wolverine's adamantium claws.
column5: "Pictograph, see book. * I prefer the primitive meaning of an eagle rather than vulture. Somehow vulture makes me think more about meat and dead corpses than claws. An eagle however immediately brings to my mind the image of an eagle plunging into a stream catching fish in his claws, or that of the great eagles rescuing Bilbo and his party in Jrr Tolkien's novel “Bilbo the Hobbit”."

column4: Overly gentle women are vultures who want to marry you and steal your money - not true but an easy mnemonic!
column5: An eagle must be extra gentle to pick up a dainty woman in its sharp claws.

column4: "A fledgling is being nursed at a zoo, it is fed milk through a small tube that is bent in the shape of a hook (so that it fits inside its beak). The fledgling soon becomes addicted to milk, giving us this very catchy mnemonic: “fledgling hooked on milk”."
column5: Drinking milk not only reduces cavity (#96)'s but also strengthens nails (claws) thanks astgtciv.

column4: Floating rubber ducky!!!
column5: "A nest of fledglings somehow fell into the water (maybe it was perched on a tree bending over the river), but they are safe for now as the nest is floating. The fledglings are enjoying the cruise but they are soon coming to a great waterfall... ( a little drama to help us remember the story)."

column4: "The leader in this race is the turtle! It appears he has covered the vulture’s feet in glue, so that the vulture cannot get off the starting block."
column5: X-men and TMNT join forces: Their new leader is an awsome asshole. He is simply Wolverine and Raphael glued together back to back (the biggest assholes from both groups combined).

column4: It's easy to picture a LEADER that uses a BIG dog to EXHORT his people to do more.
column5: "Here we have a St.Bernard exhorting the vulture to become the leader in the race against the turtle, but he can't because of the glue. see leader (#731)."

column4: "You pick cheries with your fingers, then along comes a giant vulture and picks up the whole tree with its claws."
column5: "Tip: vulture + tree : Heisig later combines these into a single kanji 采 called grab (#2090). Story: As you go to pick your nose, your parent grabs your finger and pulls it away (& gives you a lecture on social etiquette). REF: ""grab"" also appears in vegetable (#734), coloring (#1714)."

column4: "A vegetarian vulture is munching on a flower, perched on a tree, patiently waiting for a patch of vegetables to grow."
column5: Wolverine is turning into total hippie. He said he only eats vegetables now and last time I saw him sitting in a tree with flowers in his hair.

column4: The bird house is the brothel (someone else said so) and of course everyone is welcome - thay accept any crotch.
column5: "A birdhouse is a whorehouse that will accept any crotch even those with STDs. (Image: a birdhouse whorehouse with every kind of bird coming and going. Some old madam at the front hole accepts everyone, even the nasty old crows)."

column4: """Please accept this finger,"" you say, imparting it to your yakuza boss."
column5: "This character depicts a student and teacher. The teacher imparts his knowledge on the student, pointing the way and guiding with the finger. Meanwhile, the student sits there passively accepting the tutelage of his superior."

column4: "If you really love someone, you won't keep them in a cage-like bird house relationship, but rather open the door and let their heart walk around freely. Think less about ""I"" (あい) and more about ""we""."
column5: "The man is about to enter the 'birdhouse' (brothel) when he remembers his true love at home, and, following his heart, uses his walking legs to go straight home."

column4: "You're at a restaurant and raise your finger to indicate to the waiter that you want to pay. Your friend elbows you in the ribs -- it's his shout, and he insists on taking care of the bill."
column5: "You are walking out of the restaurant when the waiter uses his FINGERS to grab you at the ELBOW and says, ""excuse me sir, didn't you forget to PAY?""."

column4: The Batcave is very wide and has a lot of elbow room for Batman to do his yoga.
column5: "A wide cave has a lot of ""elbow room""."

column4: Japanese girls are tight and may require fingers inserted to broaden them and make them wide enough before you can...
column5: Spread your fingers wide to broaden your hand.

column4: Elbonium: a new mineral found in wide caves shaped like elbows and made of metal.
column5: A wide range of metals are classed as minerals.

column4: Opening a stuck valve requires 2 hands and a lot of elbow grease.
column5: "The cubans build a pipe to flood the USA. Castro just has to turn the valve on it, and USA is flooded. Suddenly, CIA agents tackle him from behind, grabbing both his arms. But Castro manages to open the valve with his elbow, by raising the elbow above his head. Success! USA is no more..."

column4: Men walk with their elbows out from their sides in a weird turkey trot when they try to appear very MASCULINE. Think of a 70's pimp walk.
column5: Masculine duties are to offer your elbow to the lady by your left side and to cut the turkey on special meals.

column3: pedestal;a stand;counter for machines and vehicles
column4: When someone's elbow is above your mouth he/she is probably standing on a pedestal.
column5: "After training your whole life, you manage to get a bronze medal in the Olympics. You're extremely proud of your accomplishment as you step up to receive your medal. The guy in first place is up on a pedestal, towering above you, his elbow level with your mouth. Being a smug bastard, he ""accidentally"" knocks his elbow into your mouth, causing you to bleed and lose a tooth. Just cause he won the gold doesn't mean he can place himself on such a high pedestal and do whatever he wants!"

column4: "While standing on the pedestal at the award ceremony, the recipient heartlessly neglected to mention the people that got him there."
column5: Someone you put on a pedestal will NEGLECT your heart.

column4: From his water pedestal Neptune reigns over his Sea Empire.
column5: Build a moat around your pedestal to protect your reign of power.

column4: "Many men, before they commence their relationship with the woman of their desires, place her on something of a pedestal, which often leads to disappointment later on."
column5: "If you want to commence a relationship, just put a woman on a pedestal and she'll love ya forever."

column4: "The body part feminists like to put on a pedestal is the womb, especially when they hear a man complain about some responsibility. ""We give birth, so it's your duty to do so-and-so""."
column5: "If any body part deserves to be put on a pedestal, it is the womb from which new life springs forth."

column4: "This is either a love scene or a murder scene that you are seeing through a window. The love scene: through the window of a house (from a distance), you see a pair of human legs, then elbows, and then some pink hearts floating up like in a cartoon. The murder scene: peering through the window of a house, you see a gruesome murder scene. Human legs dangling from a ceiling fan, an elbow sticking out of a wall, and a heart still beating on the carpet."
column5: "A photographer is at home, recovering his broken human legs. With nothing better to do, he is looking through the rear window with his camera (he needs to use his elbow to support those heavy lenses) until his heart begins to race as he witnesses a murder!"

column4: """Going, going, GONE!"", said the gravedigger as he shoveled soil onto the body's protruding elbow (the last bit left to cover)."
column5: "If you want the soil stains gone from your clothes, then you'll need to put some elbow grease into cleaning them."

column4: "This kanji shows up in a lot of words related to the legal process. Try this image: using a very outdated judicial method, the people of Salem dunked accused witches in the water until they were all gone."
column5: "There already was a system (#418) for butchering cows, a technique (#421) for turning smoke into flowers - why can't there be a method of about the same relevance for making water gone? Evaporation anyone?"

column4: "At the local company they have a very gory way of getting rid of incompetent personnel : they arrange a business meeting in a very special room where the walls are ... meeting. Not surprisingly the boss is never present at these meetings, he's the one who pushes the button that sets the walls in motion."
column5: The only thing created in most meetings is a lot of hot air. Imagine a cloud of it rising to the roof.

column4: Sexual climaxes don't always happen on the bed; they sometimes happen against a wall or on the ground!
column5: The climax of the Berlin Wall affair was the tearing of it to ground.

column4: "You book a room in a love hotel called ""Climax House""."
column5: "A simple room is made up of a roof, some walls, and a dirt floor."

column4: Http://img168.imageshack.us/img168/7731/karatesd3.jpg Just look at this image...
column5: Just as we were about to climax her father arrived with a sword.

column4: To reach climax I doth the bidding of my dominatrix taskmaster.
column5: "This character is used in two very high-frequency words: ""you are welcome"" (どう致しまして) and the honorific form of onegaishimasu (お願い致します; おねがいいたします). Can't you just picture this ridiculously polite S&M picture? A businessman, who DOTH the bidding of his taskmistress, is climaxing and yelling out ""お願い致します"" while she whips and says ""どう致しまして"". (This kanji also means ""to bring about"" and ""do humbly"", which is perfect for this image)."

column4: The 69 position allows both parties to mutually give themselves pleasure.
column5: "If you can combined your walls with another house's walls, both houses would mutually benefit, by the increase in size...."

column4: "Think of a really loud and annoying baby, you want to abandon it but it keeps coming back...so you take of your belt by the buckle, and buckle the baby to a tree!"
column5: "As in sash (#415), I treat the one mountain in the middle to mean Mt. Fuji (Japan's ichiban mountain). Now we see an infant being abandoned on top of Mt. Fuji well above the tree line to die of exposure."

column4: "Bringing up your offspring means raising them from infant until they are meat ready to be harvested. What, cannibalism is in poor taste? Forget I ever brought it up. But bring up will forver be infant meat to me. I want my baby back baby back baby back ribs!"
column5: I will bring up my infants to eat meat. I'll not endure any vegetarian children in my house!

column4: "A terrible yakuza taskmaster is bringing up his infant. Every time the infant does something wrong... well, you know what happens to yakuzas when they do something wrong."
column5: """Don't lay a finger on him,"" a concerned mother says as the state REMOVES her child away for upbringing by a taskmaster foster home."

column4: "Scene at the baby factory: Manager: ""Good news! Your infant has been allotted human legs"". Parent to be: ""Thanks a lot!""."
column5: "In China, to prevent too many human legs walking around, couples are alloted only one infant…　RTK2:　ジュウ　補充　ほじゅう(supplement)…　Semi-Pure Group:　銃762　(ﾄｳ): 統1347."

column4: """Everyone is allotted a metal gun"" (US constitution according to the NRA)."
column5: What is a gun but a device for allotting pieces of metal? One for you - BANG!...One for you - BANG!...One for you - BANG!...One for you - BANG!...etc.

column4: "Sulphur is like a rock, but it can stink like a stream of infant doodie."
column5: Infants are baptised in streams inorder to prevent their descent into a place of sulphur and brimstone.

column4: INFANT Moses placed in the WATER and sent down the current of the STREAM.
column5: "A water-breathing infant (genetically modified?) is caught in a flood, and drifts with the current, apparently enjoying himself in the process."

column4: "In some Asian kung-fu version of James Bond, the main protagonist has a “License To Kill” with his deadly elbows and human legs. His suit is always stained of red blood at the elbows and lower legs (this to help create an image that distinguish the two elements)."
column5: A midget driver trying to pass the road test to get their driver's license. Their elbows are too short to turn the wheel and their legs are too short to reach the gas and breaks.

column4: I named the right part legal prostitute has it represents a walker [walking legs] with the license. It's easy to imagine a legal prostitute tempting a man with her mouth.
column5: Prostitutes in Amsterdam have a license to show off their walking legs and tempt customers with their mouths.

column4: "Suddenly, a cactus comes out of the ground with a sign that reads: exit. Now you can leave the desert! (Note: giving this primitive the meaning 'cactus' can be useful later)."
column5: The exit lays between these two mountains.

column4: "Pictograph, see book. * As a primitive this element appears equally as well at the top or bottom of the kanjis (besides appearing to the left). Since a mountain often brings to mind towering peaks, I will consider it implied that the element is placed at the top of the kanji. When this primitive appears at the bottom, I will arrange my story in a way that other elements are said to be at the very top of the mountain (see FRAME 775 for an example)."
column5: YOU CAN'T POSSIBLY NEED A MNEMONIC FOR THIS!!!!

column4: "With fingers fumbling around trying to get the key in the door so he could exit, the bungling husband woke his wife as he tried to leave for a rendezvous with his mistress."
column5: Horror movie cliche 769: Bungling victim's fingers fumble & bungle trying to open the exit door.

column4: A mountain-sized stone is known as a boulder.
column5: "Here we see mountain rocks rolling down the mountain, gathering into a single monstrous boulder crushing everything in its path. Think snowball effect, even if it wouldn't work with rocks."

column4: Burn enough charcoal and you'll have a mountain of ash.
column5: "You get charcoal from volcano (""fire mountain"", 火山) ashes."

column4: "On the left, there are three mountains. The road branches off to each of them. (Note: This kanji is mostly used for branches in the road)."
column5: "In a lot of Super Nintendo-era RPGs, there are mountain levels to get through. You view them from overhead, so you can see a mazelike path with many branches. Picture your sprite characters at one such fork in the mountain path, as it branches off in two directions."

column4: "Heisig mentions at kanjiclinic.com that he wishes he'd chosen mountain pass for this keyword as it's closer to what the word means. If we do this, the kanji makes complete sense because a mountain pass is just below the mountain top."
column5: "To the north of Lorien lies the Misty Mountains, and below their towering peaks are the Mines of Moria. The Fellowship of the Ring first tried for the MOUNTAIN PASS that goes above, but were halted by the wizardry of Saruman at Caradhras, and so are forced to take the MOUNTAIN PASS that goes below, through the mountain - a path long feared by Gandalf for the ancient evil that lurks there. Note : the kanji does in fact refer to a ""mountain pass""."

column4: Sam and Frodo were steadfast companions even as Mount Doom crumbled above them.
column5: "September 11. [lol it also has 11 strokes], whoever reported this story is a loser, get alife. This is the best story on the website."

column4: "To maintain secrecy, secret societies invariably have to house themselves in the moutains."
column5: "To maintain secrecy, secret societies invariably have to house themselves on top of the moutains. (Slight tweak of chamcham's story, using fuaburisa's idea for remembering where to put the mountain primitive.)."

column4: "When I think of honey, I think of a bee hive, which is a HOUSE that INVARIABLY has INSECTS."
column5: A house with a lot of honey will invariably attract many insects.

column4: Storm is a full-blown wind that rips the mountains off the ground (you see one flying here).
column5: "Winds are gathering at the base of the mountain (note the hint to primitive placement), going up, and turning into a huge mountain storm."

column4: "This is “Cape Strange” from FRAME 153, only with mountain in place of soil. Interestingly, there is also 碕 which is made of the primitives stone and strange. The three kanjis 碕, 埼 and 崎 all have the same meanings and pronunciations. They have very little uses other than names, for which promontory is the clear winner with over 2300 uses in place and people names, while the other two kanjis account for less than 200 names."
column5: "A promontory is a small, strange mountain that juts out into the sea."

column4: "Pictograph, see book. * As a primitive, using the image of going through a door, even one that stands alone with the frame and no wall around, helps flesh out the primitive “enter”."
column5: Person enters stage left…　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　RTK2:　ニュウ　入院　にゅういん(admittance into a hospital).

column4: During a traffic jam it is impossible to get your car to enter the roadway as it is crowded with cars. Think of a grid lock so bad cars are litterally scraping up against each other like people on a Japanese train during rush hour.
column5: Everybody tries to enter the road during rush hour. That's why it's so crowded.

column4: "When something is entered by a dagger, it ends up being cut in several parts."
column5: "(This kanji also has the meanings of ""understand"" and ""minute""). It's important to understand that were you to enter an hour with a dagger and cut it into parts, those parts would be minutes."

column4: "In the case of true poverty, not having money is only part of the problem. There are other components as well, like lack of education, class structuring, etc., but that doesn't really matter. Just remember that the money is only part of it, not the whole."
column5: Parting with your money will lead to poverty.

column4: The PART of my HEAD where I remember the KANJI is in the kanji PARTITION.
column5: "The last time I tried to partition a hard drive under Linux, I got a severe migraine that parted my head."

column4: I always open the doors to the public restrooms with my elbows because I don't want to touch the door with my hands.
column5: I always enter the doors to the public restrooms with my elbows because I don't want to touch the door with my hands.

column4: "Following up with the ""entering public restrooms"" story for the right-hand primitive: public restrooms always reek of pine tree scented disinfectant."
column5: "A pine tree is a public tree: they are frequently planted in public squares, in commemoration of the respect Conficius held for them."

column4: "The venerable old man is the public figure head of the Native American Village, answering all questions and solving all problems. The higher in rank you get in this tribe, the more feathers decorate you. Imagine this old man covered in beautiful feathers."
column5: "The venerable old man is using the public restroom in the park where he feeds the pigeons. But, alas, there is no toilet paper! So, he's caught a pigeon and is using it to wipe his bottom. (note the feathers on the bottom of the kanji, this helps remember placement). Can you see the feathers flying everywhere?"

column4: Take care what words you say in public lest you be sued.
column5: "[+radical_tyro] Socrates was giving a speech in public. Things were going rather well, until his robe opened a bit and people saw his, well, not-public area. He was promptly sued for public indecency. Certain things shouldn't be made public in public, you know?"

column4: "This could be seen as a very accurate pictograph of another type of valley: a valley mouth open under the umbrella of inner labia, with the outer labia parted above. There are even more connections to be made among the primitive keywords and the visuals, but i will enter no further..."
column5: Think of the classic anime 風の谷のナウシカ (Nausicaa of the Valley of the Wind). We see Nausicaa entering the valley mouth gliding on an umbrella.

column4: "This story is quite lascivious, sorry... Now, imagine you are at a 混浴　（こんよく） [two kanjis we now know] Onsen (温泉), and you are watching a woman bathe. Just picture the water dripping down her cleavage (that valley in between her breasts). Note: cleavage in Japanese is 谷間."
column5: The mountain man uses the water from the valley to bathe.

column4: Imagine a house big enough to contain an entire valley. might want to live there. And now imagine cleaning it. . . . Maybe not . . .
column5: Biodome.

column4: Think of what happens when the snow on top of the mountains melts: it turns into water and flows down onto the rooftops of all the houses in the valley below.
column5: "[melt; dissolve; thaw] An ice cube is melting, loosing the water it contained."

column4: "Guess what? Japanese has dirty words too! (In fact, a lot of them) A sexual story is NOT inappropriate here, as this kanji is very sexual, such as in 性欲; lust. As for a story: the lack of contact with a woman's valley will leave a man LONGING for love."
column5: The valley has something my life is lacking.... something I've been longing for.. peace and quiet.

column4: "Again using the fact that cleavage in Japanese is called ""valley of the chest"": a woman with abundant cleavage tightly wraps up her bosom in a form-fitting cloak, but leaving her valley exposed. Another unforgettable image (thank you, thank you, I'll be here all week)."
column5: "Welcome to cloak-valley, the valley where everyone wears cloaks and every shop sells cloaks. Mnemonic : “cloaks are abundant in the valley”."

column4: Picture the molten lead (the heavy metal) being discreetly drained out of the factory into a gully behind.
column5: Lead -> Dental fillings -> Metal that enters the mouth to fill a hole in a tooth.

column4: Water in a gully runs alongside the path.
column5: Picture one of those idiots that run alongside the bicyclists in the Tour de France trying to give them water. Watch as the cyclist shoves the person into a gully that runs alongside the road.

column4: "This is a bit silly.. or maybe not only a bit, but.. You know some foodstuffs (cereals come to mind) sometimes have prizes mixed in them? Well, in this case, the prize was a shell (money, remember) and you only notice in the outhouse... (see also secret (#904))."
column5: "As a prize for being the 1,000,000th person to use the restaurant's outhouse, I got all the clams I could eat."

column4: "Every major political party, if personified, would look like a giant outhouse walking around with human legs spewing out a constant stream of bullshit."
column5: "Every political party is full of shit. But nobody ever says how they get that way. Well, here's your answer - a political party memer is in the outhouse, greedily chowing down on the contents inside. He's grown so accustomed to the taste that he's in all the way, and all you can see are his legs through the window. He'll come inside later to the auditorium to make a speech and spew everything out."

column4: In most communities you will be hauled into city hall if you use the ground as an outhouse.
column5: There is a secret hall buried in the soil underneath the outhouse.

column4: It's usual to take your towel with your when you go to the outhouse at the onsen (hot springs bath in Japan) so everybody doesn't see your stuff.
column5: "In the outhouse toilet you'd usually hope to find toilet paper to wipe your ass. If it's already gone, which is usually the case, simply use the towel."

column4: "Compared to pants, a SKIRT is the GARMENT to be wearing when you want to use one of those Japanese toilets. It makes it so much easier: you just walk in the OUTHOUSE hike it up, and do your business."
column5: "Haven't you ever noticed that the men / women signs on the front of outhouses are sometimes very similar? The silhouettes are usually the same, but one will decidedly be wearing a garment in the shape of a SKIRT. Also, we've already learned the kanji for ""woman"", so if the signs are only in kanji you have no right to wander in and claim ignorance, perv!"

column4: "If you're going to manipulate your body with your hand, then go do it in an outhouse, at least!"
column5: "Instead of magazines, we keep a Rubiks Cube in the outhouse to manipulate with your hands while you do your business."

column4: A pelt is hooked on a branch. A small tent is made with a pelt and a branch planted in the ground. The mnemonic hints at the first stroke (the hanging pelt) and the hook at the end of the second stroke. This is chinese radical #107 meaning “skin”.
column5: "To be honest, this is one of those cases where I have found it easier to ""just remember it"" as a radical, as it occurs so frequently: 彼（かれ him）波（なみ wave）and so on."

column4: Waves are the ocean's pelt (skin).
column5: "The Inuit used water-proof seal pelts for their kayaks, to travel the waves."

column4: "An old woman is seen here as a woman with waves (i.e. wrinkles, creases)."
column5: "You know ""The Old Man and the Sea."" Well, this is the sequel, ""The Old Woman and the Sea Waves.""."

column4: "You expose holes in a pelt by passing your fingers through them and wiggling them on the other side. The sense of the kanji here is to reveal something that was hidden, to make known, to open your heart (thus revealing it, exposing it to others), express your opinion, etc."
column5: "Think of it in this vulgar way. You really want her to expose her “beaver” pelt, so you have to encourage her with your fingers to expose it."

column4: "Before the invention of scissors or knives, sharp STONES were used to REND PELTs, so that caveman designers could complete new styles for the upcoming year."
column5: "Rend is a violent, primitive kind of word. (Image: cavemen rending pelts right off live animals with stone tools)."

column4: If you wear a coat of fur (pelt) you are sure to incur the wrath of animal rights extremists.
column5: A cloak of fur (pelt) will incur the wrath of animal lovers.

column4: "The remainder of the bones have been thrown from the float (for the dogs maybe, at the end of the parade)."
column5: Throwing all those coins (see coin (#368)) was a really bad idea; people got mad with greed. The only remainders left were the bones of those that was on the float.

column4: "Think of the early Christian martyrs who suffered martyrdom because of their faith. See them held in cells for 10 days (a decameron) before being fed to the lions. They appear before the chanting Roman crowds as bones to be devoured. Think of what was leftover after the lions finished them off....nothing, not even a pile of bones to bury."
column5: The boney man martyred himself during his 10 day hunger-strike.

column4: A t-bone steak is vermilion - particularly if served rare.
column5: Castlevania -- The vermillion skeletons (bones) are particularly hard because they just keep regenerating.

column4: Advertisement for Breast Implants -- Tired of nights all alone? Want to get boned straightaway? AUGMENT your breasts and all your troubles will be solved!
column5: "In the movie “Gattaca”, Vincent Freeman (played by Ethan Hawke) augments his size by straightening his bones (his legs), in order to match up with the genetically “perfect” population, and reach his goal of travelling in space. The stretching of his lower leg bones involved multiplying the bone cells, another sense of this key word."

column4: "A line of skeletal warriors, all armed with sabers."
column5: Skeleton army rank and file. Dudes made of bones carrying sabres.

column4: "They tried issuing the skeleton warriors with proper garments to wear, but they kept getting split by the sharp bones or by their sabres. In the end, it was decided they look scarier naked anyway."
column5: Someone takes a sword made of bone to split the garment right down the middle. Very effective.

column4: "The nazis were ardent believers in the master arian race, see them marching everyone else into the oven fires, single file."
column5: "The undead, marching single file, prove how ardent they are be walking across a field of flame. Fun fact, ardent used to mean to burn."

column4: "Ok, this is where knowing some Eastern culture comes in handy! In Japanese society, when someone dies they creamate the body and pick out the remaining bones with special chopsticks. In this case, they're out of chopsticks so they decide to use (gasp!) a spoon instead."
column5: "Imagine the grim reaper (the bringer of death), carrying a spoon made of human bones instead of a scythe."

column4: "I imagine an interment as a funeral. At this funeral it's an open casket, and the dead body (death) is holding flowers with both of its hands."
column5: "During the interment ceremony, the grandchildren placed flowers over the dead body while the widow sat praying with two hands."

column4: "Imagine Snoopy winking with his big eyes (and a happy smile) standing next to Woodstocks Birdhouse, woodstock being so cool that he wears little sunglasses."
column5: "What a dilemna, you wore SUNGLASSES over your EYES when you went to the BIRDHOUSE so you wouldn't be recognized - but now you can't WINK at the girl you want!"

column4: "Your ear is like the eye on the side of your head for seeing things, but there is hair around it that creates jagged lines."
column5: "Pictograph, see book. * The primitive meaning can easily be extended to ear plugs."

column4: "You put your ear next to a womans crotch...and somehow, from it, you hear the words ""Take me....""."
column5: Fuaburisu's with a twist: You know that classic trick where someone pretends to take something out of an someone else's ear (such as a coin). Instead of a cigarette or a pen he pulls the person’s crotch out of their ear. Very painful!

column4: The gist of it is this: We take the money and run!
column5: "Pickpocket advice: It's simple, FIRST run, then take. Yeah, that's the gist of it!"

column4: "TAKE the UTMOST care when you SUN bath all DAY, or you'll get burned from your EARS to your CROTCH."
column5: Do your utmost - seize(take) the day.

column4: Take the utmost care that you don't have your finger in the way when you take a snapshot.
column5: "When I learned photography from my dad as a little girl, he explained the basics to me: ""when you take a snapshot, be careful not to put your fingers before the lens, and don't look towards the sun (this was in the days that photographs would be spoiled by direct sunlight)."

column4: Amelia Ear-Heart (sic) brought shame to those who said women couldn't fly.
column5: Vincent Van Gogh's greatest shame was cutting off his ear to win the heart of a woman.

column4: Worst post in history: quality checker at the kazoo factory. Imagine the toll on your ears!
column5: "Buckingham Palace guards are famous for staying at their post no matter what, even if you blow a kazoo in their ear!"

column4: "The trick for me is to remember that the 耳 is to the left of the 口. However, this is easy because a true holy man uses his ear to listen (i.e., to God or his supplicant) before he opens his mouth to speak, unlike a charlatan who just makes something up. Of course, kings are often true holy men and prophets (e.g., King David in the bible)."
column5: "A holy man hears with his ears before he speaks with his mouth, which places him higher than a king in people's esteem."

column4: Only a truly daring Japanese student would wear a spike in his ear under the gaze of the Japanese teacher taskmasters!
column5: See that ear nailed over there ? It's the ear of the last person who was too daring with the taskmistress.

column4: "I promise to use my ear to do nothing but listen ... stick a needle in my eye, cross my heart and hope to die! (Intentionally said backwards to get the order of the primitives correct)."
column5: "Listening to others is different from hearing [1626] with the ear. One must allow the words to pierce through the eyes (the window of the soul) and reach deep into the heart...a symbol of thinking about and contemplating on what was said, not just the sounds of words spoken. A married man while reading his newspaper, his wife going on about something suddenly, says, ""You're not listening to me, are you?"" He replies, ""I heard every word you said. You said..."" “Yes, but you're not listening.""."

column4: "(re: taijuando) When you are in New York City you have to be alert, i.e. in the ""New York State of Mind"": you need ten eyes to make sure no one will go through your garments and pick your pockets."
column5: "Imagine Darth Vader's state of mind when he discovers his garment has not pockets. "" D O NOT WANT!""."

column4: "I'll focus on the mandala primitive here. I guess Heisig chose this keyword for phonetic reasons and as a character it's the ""man"" in mandara/mandala (曼荼羅). A mandala is a graphic representation of the universe, here split in 3 planes of existance, the sun representing the cosmos, the eye represents the human observer, the crotch represents the animal instincts."
column5: He' s often ridiculed for having his eye on crotches all day.

column4: "One obscure Tibetan sect-- the Otaku cult-- has an unusually loose interpretation of mandala drawing practice. Instead of traditional mandalas they draw mangas (漫画). They then pour water on the image to wash it away, and begin anew."
column5: Even NELSON MANDALA dreams of drops of WATER glistening on comic book/ anime girls with LOOSE morals. (This story has been edited in response reports).

column4: "When something catches my eye, I take out a few clams and buy before anybody else does."
column5: Rules to Buying: 1. You've had your eye on it for a while. 2. You have enough shells to afford it.

column4: "On the JET Programme, many people have their eye on a placement in Tokyo, Osaka or another big city, and write it on their application form. They are usually sent to the countryside straightaway."
column5: Working in retail you learn the placement of any item should be at eye level so it's seen straightaway.

column4: "For Japanese, when the mind's eye (the sideways eye) feels guilty for something bad that the body has done, there are two penaltys to choose from. One, you can say I'm sorry. Two, you can commit suicide by sabre. Why, oh why, do so many Japanese executives commit suicide at the first sign of scandal when all the have to do is say I'm sorry to get off the hook. (on yomi: バチ, バツ)."
column5: There is a 3-way masterplan for every goalkeeper to prevent a goal at penalty shootout: 1. Look directly into the eyes of the player --- 2. Confuse him by screaming senseless words --- 3. Pull out you your saber and ... (that's up to you).

column4: "A pretty tough kanji. Think of elegant old housewives with English accents dining together at a HOUSE party. The hostess brings out a dish of hors d'oeuvres: a SPIKE of metal with an EYEBALL and a HEART skewered on it. Upon being offered this treat, one of the housewives says in her English accent, ""I'd RATHER not.""."
column5: Rather a house with a heart than an eye with a spike.

column4: "The fly is wrapped in a spiderweb voicing ""Help me, Help Me"" under the watchful eye of the spider who's venom is dripping like water from her fangs."
column5: Pour water over the eyes of a bound up insect if you want to hear a pitiful buzz that is very similar to a VOICED consanant.

column4: "Together with the next kanji, the keywords spell “send back the ring”. First we have a jewel. Next we have the great eye of Sauron searching for the fellowship hiding under the many ceilings during their journey. The fourth and fifth primitives are the mouth of Gollum always mumbling “My preciousss”; and Pippin's scarf! Placement: the eye appears at the top similarly to how the Great Eye of Sauron is perched atop the Dark Tower."
column5: "In conjunction with send back (#837)....... When I tried to give her the jewel ring, she eyed me, threw it to the floor, opened her mouth and tried to speak, she said nothing. She grabbed her scarf and left."

column4: "You've probably guessed it by now, this is the road that Sam and Frodo take to send back the ring to Mount Doom! (see previous frame, the jewel is replaced by the road)."
column5: "Continued from ring (#836)....... So I'm on the road going to send back the ring minus the jewel, the hit to the floor knocked it out."

column4: "Even though it is argued size is not important, I'm sure most women would like their husband to have a big one."
column5: "Homer Simpson, as a primitive."

column4: Using his finger the husband sometimes is an erotic aid to his partner.
column5: "In Homer Simpsons' house, the first aid kit is usually used for when he smashes his fingers trying to build something (there are countless Simpsons episodes you can draw from for this)."

column4: The Simpsons are on vacation. Homer stops to take a leak in a mountain stream but gets snatched by an eagle. Hear his scream?
column5: "A husband who went fishing at the mountain stream to feed his family, fell in the rapids (we'll assume this is a large mountain stream). He is saved from the waters by a great eagle. He comes back home with nothing to feed the family, his clothes still dripping wet as he tells his wife of how he was saved by a great eagle, and of course she does not believe him. The story continues in chicken (#1947)."

column4: "In the male-dominated world of yesterday, the husband's way of seeing things was considered the standard point of view. Women who dared to disagree were frowned upon."
column5: "Unfortunately, Homer Simpson is the standard model of a husband in American society. (Placement: You have to look in the RIGHT places to find one that doesn't fit that mold.)."

column4: "A show like ""Trading Spouses"" called ""exchanging husbands"" where 2 husbands are exchanged for a day (thanks dingomick)."
column5: Marge's dream: to exchange Homer for another husband for just one day.

column3: approve;praise;title or inscription on picture;assist;agree with
column4: "Out of two potential husbands, which would you approve of? Well, the one with shells (money) of course!!!"
column5: "Bush's campaign- ""John Kerry approves using taxpayers' money to support gay marriage. I don't."" ""I approve this message""."

column4: When a submarine or similar vessel SUBMERGES an EXCHANGE of air for WATER takes place in special compartments.
column5: "The two husbands exchange for a day on the reality TV show (see exchange (#842)) finally goes underway. One of the two husband's first job is to fix the water faucet in his new family's apartment. Unfortunately, he isn't very good at fixing things and after a few failed attempts the entire apartment is submerged in water."

column4: "The drop falling here is the husband's toupee... he's already lost his hair once, now he's losing it again. Such is life, I suppose."
column5: "Note: Heisig's stroke order is wrong. It's the same as vermilion, drop first. Homer loses/drops his wedding ring."

column4: Iron is a metal that gradually becomes lost due to oxidation and rust.
column5: "Compare with pig-iron (#270). In moving from pig-iron to iron, some of the metal's maleability is LOST. (The only difference between the two kanji is that IRON has knee-less, unbending legs, while PIG-IRON (270) has very supple, bendable legs.)."

column4: "When you get lost, you just take an alternate road to get back on track."
column5: "When you lose your way, you can always try to tell the wife that you merely took an alternate road. To save time you know. I'm not LOST, I'm just taking an alternate road. Ahem."

column4: Its a pictograph of a teeth with a retainer in the middle.
column5: Retainer = A slave (for the purposes of this kanji.) This is a pictograph of a slave collar with two handcuffs dangling from it.

column4: Princess Leia becomes Jabba's slave (“princess Leia is a woman slave”).
column5: Cinderella: A woman who was a slave who became a princess.

column4: "The storehouse is overgrown with slaves. The slaves are to be sold in the store, to differentiate from a warehouse, which doesn't have the word ""store"" in it."
column5: Slaves moved flowers from the storehouse in preparation for the parade.

column4: "You signed your organ donor card, right? So, when you die, your entrails and other body parts will be placed in a storehouse."
column5: "Again with the Pyramids, each Pharaoh had their entrails taken out and put into little jars that were shaped in the forms of their Gods and entombed along with the preserved body. So, the entrails are the parts of the body that are placed in the storehouse along with the Pharaoh! Damnit, why can't they always be this easy? :(."

column4: An intelligent man is neither slave to his crotch nor to money. But an intelligent slave will know how to use his/her crotch to make money.
column5: "Every intelligent man is a slave to two things, his: 1) crotch, and 2) money."

column4: "The strict parent thinks adolescent kids are ""slaves to their crotch"" (= can't control their hormones), so he grounds them. Permanently!"
column5: I'm very strict about not just sleeping with anyone. People who are slaves to their crotches often end up with dirty genitalia and I don't want to get their VD. (on yomi=ケン).

column4: "The slave is look to the future, ""One day"" he thinks ""I will be able to recline with all my goods, a tv, stereo and washing machine, and when that day comes I shall be truly happy"" he sighs."
column5: "Imagine a slave(or in this case, a female porn star) looking to her new gangbang film where she reclines and gets all 3 holes filled at the same...........OK. Very vulgar, but I was inspired by raulir's clever use of ""3 holes""........."

column4: "The slave reclines on the floor at night to watch the stars. Since that's the only thing the slave is allowed to “read”, he does so very thoroughly and diligently, hence perusal."
column5: "[+scottamus] ""Please, come in and peruse this fine selection of slaves, all reclining here on the floor for your perusal. Have a look here"": http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/09/Slave_ship_diagram.png/440px-Slave_ship_diagram.png."

column4: "This is actually the top view of a porn star with a gigantic erect penis. The top and bottom are his arms and the middle is his penis. Imagine him making the pumping motion while he's banging some chick. The arms move in, the penis moves out and vice versa."
column5: "The letter E, with a GIGANTIC middle stroke."

column4: Having gigantic fingers is useful to repel insects. You can swat them away a lot easier!
column5: "A woman might be REPELLED by a porn star's GIGANTIC penis, so he kindly offers to use his FINGERS instead."

column4: "I always refer to the power of the KATAKANA ""KA""."
column5: I have a very powerful muscle カ in my driveway!

column4: "Male is seen here as muscles working in the field, in other words working in the rice fields is the work of the male who are usually stronger. This is more or less the meaning of the original Chinese character."
column5: "When it comes to choosing a MAN, I prefer brains over muscles."

column4: Those jocks who always tried to show their muscles in the schoolhouse are now the ones out there doing manual labor jobs while we sit here and learn Japanese. Ha!
column5: "At the schoolhouse, the administration develops the children's muscles by making them do manual labour."

column4: The necromancer hangs out at the local graveyard and uses his dark powers to recruit an army of undead. Emphasize the verb form to keep distinct from the noun cadet (#1173).
column5: WANTED: Hardworking GRAVEYARD diggers. Must have 6 months experience with POWERFUL muscles as will be working in South Africa burying deceased elephants.

column4: I have an inferiority complex because I have fewer muscles than everyone else at the gym. They all look like Macho Man Randy Savage (power) to me.
column5: "I had trouble remembering the relative position of the components, so now I use this story: Even muscular men have inferiority if they have few things above their muscles (i.e., brain cells)."

column4: "The great achievements of humankind, were crafts completed by muscle power: the pyramids, the Eiffel tower, etc."
column5: All of Arnold Schwarzenegger's achievements started with him crafting his muscles.

column4: "Mnemonic ""pegasus persuasion power"". I think of the hippogriff from Harry Potter as being like a pegasus. To befriend a hippogriff, you have to persuade it you mean no harm, you can do this if you have ""pegasus persuasion power""."
column5: It would take a powerful argument to persuade me Pegasus was real… RTK2:　カン　勧奨　かんしょう(encouragement)… 　　　　　　　　Semi-Pure Group:　歓570　観572 　(ｹﾝ): 権571.

column4: GUY POWER!!! Body builders toiling in the gym all day....　　　　　RTK2:　ド　努力　どりょく (effort)...　Pure Group: 　奴702 　怒703.

column4: "10,000 Persians are at the base of the cliff, but the leader of the 300 Spartans just flexes his huge muscles and encourages his men by shouting that they have the power to fight them all."
column5: "People encourage you, giving you the power so you can dive off the 10,000m high cliff into the sea."

column4: "If you eat anymore, you will be adding more カロries. (katakana karo)."
column5: "This is Power Mouth, the most annoying neighbour in the world who always has something to add."

column4: "When someone at work gets married, you pass around an envelope to which you add some money and a card which you sign with your congratulations."
column5: Congratulations are so much better when you add money to them.

column4: Instant wood. Just add Viagra.
column5: I'm not sure I know about erector sets or tinker toys but I do know about jenga. You play by taking wooden pieces from the middle of a wooden tower and adding them to the top. In this way you erect a very unstable structure.

column4: "What part of the body has a very, very, very powerful smell? The armpit, of course!"
column5: "(no important on yomi) The part of Conan's body that is three times more effective at defeating foes than his muscles are his stinky ARMPITs. [Note: Typically, when the flesh primitive is on the left side it refers to a body part - this helps distinguish in from threaten (#871)]."

column4: "Compare the primitive positions of armpit (#870) and threaten (#871). When your triceps rest alongside your body, they fit snugly against your armpit. When you hold them above your body, however, your posture becomes quite threatening."
column5: Don't threaten a warewolf. He's three times as powerful ON a full moon.　RTK2:　キョウ　脅迫　きょうはく (blackmail)…　Pure Group:　協872.

column4: "The nurse says : “If you co-operate, that needle (syringe) in your triceps won't hurt”. Note: both co- and cooperate are meanings for this kanji."
column5: Co-operation: 3 persons can have the power of ten if they co-operate.

column4: I use The Flash for for this primitive; a superhero who is always going very fast.
column5: "To me, this looks like a bridge going over a body of water, being supported by columns underneath it.
