column4: "Aru starts with a. To most Japanese, the differance between ""a"" and ""the"" is confusing. It wasn't ""the"" mouth of someone important on the floor at the fiesta, it was just a mouth of a common drunk."
column5: "A is an indefinate article alright. At this fiesta, the band wern't the genuine article either. So the patrons threw them off the stage (""Aaaaaa!"") and pressed their mouthes against the floor. ""Sing no more you talentless hacks!!'."

column4: "A ""chop shop"" is a place where stolen cars are taken, and parts chopped off with an axe, to be sold."
column5: I wanted a convertible so I chopped off the top of my car with an axe.

column4: There is no excuse (#1972) 免 for you un-binding this rabbit out of its cage so that it can drop pellets all over my new carpet!
column5: "A real rabbit always leaves DROPs of poo pellets behind, and his ears are no longer bound up (compere excuse (#1972)), so they flap above like helicopter blades (pictograph), and his MOUTH still is wide-open with the STAFF-like tongue, and his powerful LEGS still look like a human's."

column4: "This is the kanji for the classical form of ""is"". I think Heisig's keyword ""est"" is the old english or latin word for ""is"". The Scorpion this est!"
column5: """Est"" is the latin third person singular of the verb ""esse"" (to be) in Latin. So, this word has been chosen to point out that this character is found chiefly in Classical Japanese (also names). I imagine an incredibly haughty Latin Scorpion, looking down at his vast estate and saying ""Mihi est"". This literally mean ""It is to me"" and means ""It's mine"" ... this is gramatically similar to how Japanese express possession too, incidentally."

column4: The strawman had a lofty ambition of becoming human.
column5: Getting lofty up in the loft. The two lovers rolling around in the straw hit a loose board in the floor. It breaks and it ends up with one of their human legs sticking out of the bottom. Whoops.

column4: "The ""comma-design"" referred to: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tomoe."
column5: This is a comma-design outlaid in mosaic on the floor.

column4: "At this hospital, all the new offspring are immediately given little dog tags with the parent's name on them, just to be sure there is no chance of a mix-up."
column5: "I'll call this ""firstly"" since it really has the meaning of ""first time"" or ""beginning"". First thing any soldier gets is a dogtag."

column4: The zoo is full of critters.
column5: "Yup, we counted lots of critters in the zoo."

column4: "This is a violet cabbage, hanging from a nail on the kitchen wall."
column5: "Violets are blue, cabbages are green. Flowers on a spike are a sight rarely seen."

column4: Spending the day with your eye on your crotch as you meditate on the mandala.
column5: "Citing my story for ridicule (#829): ""It's clearly an Indian mandala, with the Buddha sitting cross-legged, eyes closed as in trance, beneath the sun, a symbol of the enlightenment which one can reach by practicing His teachings.""."

column4: "If it looks like a towel, speaks like a towel and walks like a towel... I wonder why Heisig didn't include this one (as an actual kanji) in RtK 1."
column5: Primative from RTK1.

column4: Think of manga where what a person says is quoted in a rising cloud.
column5: The messages of the Indian Chief were quoted in rising clouds.

column4: A magic wand is used for augury.
column5: Augury means 'the practice of interpreting omens.' Magicians have a magic wand to perform augury with.

column4: "Angels go to classes at heaven-high. They quaff their thirst for knowledge, sure that the instructors there will never give them a belt in the mouth. Not at heavan-high!"
column5: Angels enroll at heaven-high (it's even made of the elements heaven and high. How easy can it be?).

column4: """Thou shalt not kill"", 'cause the graveyard is full. There's no room left to dispose of the evidence!"
column5: "Just flowery words from the Big guy?: ""Thou shalt remember the sabbath day and keep it holy."

column4: Mr. T was selected to head up the committee studying the Yamato period.
column5: There's always a person named Yamato on every committee. And I always hate them.

column4: "Mr T approaches the knights and stabs his scissors into the table they're seated at. ""I pity the fool who questions my chivalry!""."
column5: "Mr. T believes in chivalry - so whenever he plays a game of rock, paper, scissors, he always throws scissors to let the other person win. Note that this has nothing to do with women at all (hence the absence of women in this kanji) - just with everybody being weaker than Mr T."

column4: "Mr T has been chasing some fools for a while, but they keep leaving riddle scrolls behind, making Mr T use his noggin to try and catch them. ""Mr T is fed up with these fool games!""."
column5: Mr. T invented the book because he was fed up with scrolls.

column4: "Mr T mingles amongst the crowd, seeming more comely than his usual offish self."
column5: Mr. T only likes to mingle with comely people.

column4: A person with a big ego is not afraid to treat others abruptly.
column5: Mr. T is known to be particularly abrupt with anybody that has a big ego.

column4: "Not so long ago, if Mr T was working in a field, he would have been a slave."
column5: "The first television show that Mr T ever worked on was a slavery period drama. Operating on the assumption that all black people look alike, the director decided to save on his budget by just hiring one black person. In each scene requiring slaves in the background to work a field, he would put Mr T in the rice paddy in the background. Then when they changed the scene, he would simply put Mr T there too - no changing clothes, no CG - just the same dude in the background of EVERY scene."

column4: "Mr. T orders the minstrel to play a happy song, one full of frank and mirth."
column5: "Mr T enters the royal chamber dressed up as a minstrel, playing his lute and taking orders from the monarchy. ""Say, good bard, doth thouest know the fable of King Arthur?"" ""Of course I know that one, fool!""."

column4: "Remember that sordid affair (#959) when Mr. T was caught having relations with a cow? Well, some months later the heifer drops off the child at T's place. Does Mr. T share responsibility for his animal offspring?"
column5: People normally buy their child some animal offspring such as a puppy or kitten for a pet.

column4: "Mr. T uses a baseball bat for hitting foes. ""I pity the foe! I mean fool!""."
column5: Mr. T can handle nine foes all by himself!

column4: Mr T has been charged to look after the kids. He will use his muscle to protect them and make sure their mouths are fed.
column5: Mr. T looks after the kids by making sure they get enough カロ ries.

column4: MR. T doesn't look a TRIFLE bit scared of the CABBAGE PATCH KID.
column5: To MR.T swallowing a whole CABBAGE is no more than a TRIFLE.

column4: "In the great debate between ketchup and mustard, it's well-known that Mr. T is quite biased."
column5: "In the great debate between Heinz and Hunts, it's well-known that Mr. T is quite biased. (thanks Megaqwerty!)."

column4: People make a profit in various ways. That is capitalism.
column5: "Faith, lovedoll: Mr T, having faith in the word of God, prayed really hard for the girlfriend he could never get in the regular way. God listened, but sent him a lovedoll instead. Being severely disappointed, mr T decided to prostitute her and make a profit instead."

column4: Bliss is a person in a state of happiness.
column5: "Mr. T thinks ""bliss"" sounds silly, so he's standing by his choice of ""happiness"" instead."

column4: "Mr T, angel: Believe it or not, but mr T is actually an angel. He emigrated from heavens to right the wrongs on planet earth."
column5: "When people emigrate, they believe they are going to some better place, a place which to them, is heaven-high."

column4: "Mr. T don't take a partner, especially one with no spine. ""I pity da foo got no spine"", he says."
column5: "As a PARTNER, I want a PERSON with a strong SPINE."

column4: "Mr T is dancing and singing and all that, but he's doing it on a branch. All that talent and can still still keep his balance? That's a real performing artist."
column5: (note: this is the 'ki' from kabuki).//The performing artist is a person doing Kabuki theater and dancing around with a branch in his hand.

column4: "Mr. T is a man of integrity. Every time he opens his mouth, integrity just seems to stream out."
column5: Mr T's structural integrity has been compromised. Blood and guts is flowing from his mouth.

column4: """Oy, mate"", the carpenter calls out to Mr. T, ""where did you leave my tools, mate?"" Mr. T just hates it when people call him mate. It inspires him to misuse their tools."
column5: Mates are a kind of condom that Mr T puts on his tool.

column4: Mr. T is exhausted! As is the woman who just gave him shakuhachi.
column5: "You see person holding the exhaust pipe which has just dropped off their new car, and say, ""You should return that and get your money back!"". ""Trouble is,"" they reply, ""I bought it as is""."

column4: An assistant is on Mr. T's left and an adjutant on his right. That's cause the adjutant can duck faster!
column5: "MR.T always has his adjutant on his RIGHT, and his assistant (#952) on his left."

column4: "Mr. T came to a fork in a road. He pondered which way he should go, when a large mouth appeared in the heavens above him and said ""Go west!"" So, he went to California."
column5: "Every person at the end of their life, must come to their metaphorical fork in a road, do they go into the mouth of hell, or do they go to heaven? (If it helps, I hear they play Blackjack in hell...)."

column4: "I pity da foo' with no underlings! So, Mr. T hires some janitor to make his life more comfortable."
column5: "In order to make sure his new traditional Japanese cave apartment will be comfortable, Mr. T is wise to hire a handyman who rakes the stone garden, and uses a screwdriver to fix up all of the Japanese electronics (rice cooker, TV, ect)."

column4: A memorial service is something that makes you think about a person who has died.
column5: "At a memorial service for Mr. T, everyone is thinking ""I pity that foo""."

column4: "Once again, Mr. T ventured out into the remote area to visit his old taskmaster (see permanence/remote (#958)). However, the old taskmaster has become very weak. His flesh looks like dried meat and his heart almost stopped (no heart). He stayed a whole month to take care about his former teacher."
column5: "Mr. T doesn't like dried meat. He's been known to take a walking stick to the taskmaster trying to hand him a piece of meat that had been dried out. No, Mr. T doesn't like dried meat a-t a-l-l!"

column4: """My son"", sniffs Mr. T, ""I'm so glad that you are now a college graduate"" he said."
column5: "Only after Luke Skywalker graduates as a fully-fledged jedi does Vader finally tell him the big secret - ""I'm your father... you're my son""."

column4: "Note that the meaning of this kanji is ""make (someone) do something"", not ""get by with"". Story: Mr. T doesn't rely on happenstance, he makes people do what he wants."
column5: "A person should try to make his own luck, but sometimes you have to make do with happenstance."

column4: His wife has a nifty way of making all types of ice cream in her home freezer.
column5: Sugoi! Sugoi! Ice Wife Sugoi!

column4: "(Note that per Heisig, this doesn't mean 'able to cut'; it means mentally sharp, adept, or 'on your toes'!) During the Ice Age, cavemen had to be especially careful around the woolly mammoth, because they were more mentally sharp than they looked. If the cavemen weren't careful, they could end up impaled on the mammoths' tusks!"
column5: A sharp tusk pointing out of the ice. Probably belongs to a mammoth.

column4: "You don't want the lettuce to wilt, do you? So, you put ice around the circumference of the serving tray, and then the lettuce on top of that, so it cannot wilt."
column5: "Plants wilt, wither and die when ice envelopes the circumference of their roots."

column4: "On their walk to the Promised Land (land (#1513)), our brave rice-seedlings are faced with an unforeseen obstacle: An ice glacier the size of a rain puddle. Will they be able to pull through?"
column5: "In a very harsh turn of the weather, the water of the rice fields has turned to ice! The farmers are strutting around the little rice seedlings anxiously on their walking legs, hoping that the plants will pull through and survive!"

column4: The secrets of metallurgy and smithing: get your redhot metal and bang it against the pedestal as an anvil. Then cool it quickly with lots of ice.
column5: An ICE PEDESTAL is useless in METALLURGY since it will just melt.

column4: "Much more stately than that soil podium, this is made of ice. You can still see the dude standing behind it in his top hat, and he still spouts pretty much nonsense as many times as he can, but you have to admit his showy altar is quite stately."
column5: "This stately home in Brittain has been used for winter weddings many times. A reverend in a top hat stands behind the altar in the home's chapel, which is adorned with ice sculptures. Very romantic."

column4: "I'm drying myself at the 露天風呂 (outdoor hot spring) when a sudden gust of wind catches my towel and blows it into the air. I chase after it and onlookers remark, ""Look, he's flying a kite!""."
column5: "If the wind is strong enough, even a towel makes a good kite."

column4: A lull in a storm occurs when the wind stops.
column5: The wind stops for a few minutes as the eye of the hurricane passes over lulling people into a false sense of security.

column4: "The earlybirds always get all the best food at the buffets, and all the latecomers get are just leftover bones, you can almost see the wind and tumbleweeds rolling over it."
column5: You can either fly like the wind and be an earlybird at the buffet or come late and be left with only the bones.

column4: "Souring in the winds there is only one bird left. The phoenix. It scorched the other birds, never to return..."
column5: "(The extra stroke combines with white in the bird component to make a hundred-year-old bird) The Phoenix -- the bird made famous in myth, that after it reaches hundreds of years of age, is reborn and rises again on the wind."

column4: "Because the police had confiscated the swords (though they got a receipt in return) from the group of men protecting the gold transport, bandits attacked them with sabers and slaughtered every last one of them."
column5: "The ransom note explained that if the gold was not received by the following morning, the victim would be slaughtered with a saber."

column4: Wolverine waiting atop a tree to spring down on Sabretooth at any moment.
column5: Wtf moment? This kanji means temple. Wooden x-men statues with sabres guard the entrance to the Professor Xavier temple. Might help if you imagine the two x-men as Wolverine and Sabretooth.

column4: Peel off the outside of the broom that sweeps up rice grains to reveal a saber.
column5: "A multi-purpose broom! It cleans, it sweeps (rice!), it hits! In fact, peel off the mahogany exterior to uncover a sabre! It slices, it dices, it kills!"

column4: The younger brother wants to look cool and shaves himself with a saber instead of a razor.
column5: My younger brother looks like Sabretooth and needs to shave.

column4: The muchacho sits down bound up to enjoy his own aroma.
column5: "If you bind up a person and let him sit for several days, an unpleasant aroma will result."

column4: Your elbow is bound up so that your biceps will stay flexed.
column5: "My elbow was bound up in a cast, making it impossible to keep it flexed."

column4: "The poor chihuahua who had fallen down a cliff was totally despondent about his position. He saw the sun and the moon pass by, but expected no rescue any more."
column5: "The sun above the moon =total eclipse. Confused by the darkness of the total eclipse, the dog fell off the cliff and became a completely despondent mangled mess."

column4: "I've been sent to chase the wild goose! I'm here at the top of the cliff, and I can hear Mr. T and that tricky turkey down there sniggering about sending me on a search for the wild goose."
column5: "Mr T is sent on a mission to find a wild goose that swallowed some important, top-secret chemicals (they were in a baggie, so he has to find it before it dissolves!). After searching for clues and tracks, he finds it - and backs it up against a cliff. In a heroic move, Mr T jumps off the cliff, grabs the wild goose, and lands on the ground on his back, protecting the volatile wild goose. He then looks at it - wait - this isn't the wild goose, this is a mere turkey! Sent on a wild goose chase!"

column4: "The police hoped to catch the crooks making counterfeit money, but it all turned out to be a wild goose chase."
column5: You catch a wild goose that lays money (shells) instead of eggs. Unfortunately the bank declares it counterfeit.

column4: "What happened to the kitchen? It was here a second ago... Well, it fell off the cliff. See the table down there below the edge of the cliff? Maybe we can glue it back together. Of course, first we've got to retrieve the kitchen from the base of the cliff."
column5: I took that Natto (bean glue) out of the kitchen and threw it off a cliff like any rational person would.

column4: "So, you found a dead person abandoned at the bottom of the cliff? You think I might be involved? What are you trying to insinuate?!"
column5: That nasty person likes to insinuate that I am afraid of heights and can't climb a cliff.

column4: Boy scouts nowadays blow sparks out of their mouth to start a fire. Sure beats rubbing two sticks together .
column5: "Good scouts extinguish (#144) candles with their mouth, not with water. Otherwise the smoke might tell the enemy where they are."

column4: "When I wake up, I am always late, so I hurry to work. With a bad case of perpetual morning breath, I am the subject of derision at my office whenever I open my mouth."
column5: "If morning breath emanates from your mouth, you are subject to derision!"

column4: Each time I see this kanji I reprehend the person primitive for knocking the each primitive out of shape.
column5: "You only reprehend him because he is reprehensible! He walks around kicking people, like he wants to dispose of them. And that's all on top of having a big mouth. Reprehensible! Of course you must be the one to reprehend him."

column4: If someone's whispering you'd need three ears close to his mouth to be able to hear it.
column5: "It's funny how if I just talk, no one listens, but if I whisper, many ears are eager to hear what's coming from my mouth."

column4: Mouths like to chatter about the new generation on the tree.
column5: Two good friends looking at their childhood tree house and remembering how it seemed like generations ago since they were up in it chattering away all night.

column4: "You can't breathe very well, so the doc looks inside your mouth to find the cause. ""Oh, I see the cause of your windpipe blockage. There's a St Bernard penned up in there!""."
column5: "Imagine a group of windpipes chatting: “That mouth is the cause of all my problems, you know, always breathing in germs, etc.”."

column4: Mouths quarrel over who is more splendid.
column5: These very competitive neighbours open their mouths and quarrel every day about whose silage stack with flowers looks more splendid.

column4: "If you open your mouth to gossip about people, it's usually the most fun if you have some juicy bits on people who are generally revered, for instance that they are secretly glued to their bottle of Horned Whiskey."
column5: """Did you know that the most revered (#1439) chieftain (#2906) is not only a horny guy, but an alcoholic, too? Ah, and I forgot, he also sniffs glue... Ups, did that come out of my mouth? No, no... I NEVER gossip!""."

column4: "I looked up, opened my mouth and suddenly an acorn fell in! I had to cough it up quickly so that I wouldn't choke."
column5: A squirrel's mouth coughs up an acorn.

column4: To clamor means to open your mouth and proclaim loudly your opinions.
column5: "For this keyword, I am reminded of the Night Before Christmas, with the father awakening to see what was the clamor, and his mouth dropping open as he sees the fat bearded man spanning the rooftops (bounding from one house to the other)."

column4: """If the marquis opens his mouth one more time, I'll cut his throat"", his rival the baron said."
column5: The Marquis de Sade was kinda gay. He used to mouth down a lot of deep-throat action.

column4: "When some people are sleeping, their mouths droop open, and saliva drips out."
column5: Saliva drools from a mouth that droops. つば.

column4: "These &^% stamps won't stay fixed to the envelop when I lick them with my mouth. No matter how hard I bash them, they come loose every time. Aargh!"
column5: "For me, the kanji looks like a picture of two eyes. Somebody bashed the right one until it burst open. Ugh... Put a stamp on it - I don't want to see it!"

column4: うそ = Something void of truth coming from your mouth.
column5: A statement void of truth uttered by a mouth is a fib.

column4: "Just like the ones on a rhinoceros, there are little birds who like to peck at the skin near the mouth of a sow and clean it."
column5: "If your girlfriend looks like a sow, you do not kiss her on the mouth. Just a little peck at the cheek."

column4: "Caution: this means a spell, not to swear. I put a curse on my elder brother so that he can never open his mouth."
column5: Your older brother's mouth often curses.

column4: The mouth of a chihuahua is good at barking.
column5: "The mouth of a bird is chirping鳴, just as the mouth of a dog is barking."

column4: Dangle a bib or towel under my baby son's mouth.
column5: A towel dangles under his mouth to keep him clean at dinner.

column4: Use your teeth to chew what you put in your mouth.
column5: """When you open your mouth, don't take in more food than you can handle, and chew it properly with your teeth"", mum told us."

column4: """come true"" is a better keyword IMO. If you speak your wish 10 times it will come true."
column5: "With his big mouth he claims he can do ten things at once. ""It's all within my ability"", he boasts."

column4: Look at the sides of his mouth! His moustache is tied into great knots. They're not even symetrical. Look at the knots on the right side of the mouth! (though they're there on both sides of the mouth....
column5: Dimples. Those knots on the sides of the mouth. Too easy.

column4: """S... Si... S... Sir!"" the beggar's mouth stammers when appealing for some help from the business man. See the mouth open and close like a fish out of water would."
column5: "If you had a gun in your mouth begging for your life, you would stammer too."

column4: "He really can spin a tale. Every time he opens his mouth, some new and creative tale comes out."
column5: "Oh yeah, suuure - tell us a new one..."

column4: "Miso is full of active microbial cultures, so when you put it in your MOUTH, those bacteria just INCREASE and INCREASE until your mouth is overflowing with miso!"
column5: "Mouth, eyebrows, eyeballs with pupils crossed looking down at the bowl, flapping tongue: A Japanese man eating miso soup."

column4: The new generation of pop songs have no depth. They just mouth empty lyrics to get money. Not like the pop songs of my day.
column5: A new way for sluts to use their mouths to make alot of money.

column4: A kid gets scolded if they don't put the spoon properly into their mouth when eating.
column5: "If I got scolded, I could expect a spoon of castor oil in my mouth."

column4: "The city walls are beautifully built. High above you, shows you the famous mouths of former city mayors, all smiling down at you, integrated into a total mosaic making the city walls a unified beautiful work of art."
column5: "I stand outside the city walls, requesting permission to enter. The guard hands me a Rubik's cube and tells me ill only be allowed in after I fit the whole thing in my mouth..."

column4: His mouth fell open dumbfounded when he woke up and found himself on top of a tree.
column5: The first time I saw an Australian apricot tree (呆 vs. 杏) I was dumbfounded.

column4: Ingest is a fancy word for what you do with your mouth as you eat.
column5: "Note: This is a colloquial word for ""eat"", so the formal keyword ""ingest"" might better be replaced with something like ""scoff"" or ""tuck in"", etc. Suggested story: ""Yeuk! I can see the food rolling around in your mouth when you scoff it like that!""."

column4: "This one rhymes: ""If you fights wiz Cassius Clay, you'll hit the soil, boy, straightaway!""."
column5: Clay is a soil that becomes anything straightaway with heat.

column4: "While ""autochthonous"" can mean ""indigenous"" in ENGLISH, that is NOT one of the potential meanings of this character (thus, the majority of these stories will not help you with meaning). Rather, the kanji is ""autochthonous"" in the sense of being Earthly, mystic, and portentous (the ancient, primitive, sacred power of DIRT and SOIL). A vague, poorly-chosen keyword all around. Mantixen's story does the best job of conveying accurate meaning--> ""A monkey likes the earthy/autochthonous feel of soil""."
column5: A monkey likes the earthy feel of soil.

column4: "After our pre-Thanksgiving massacre, we piled high all the turkey corpses atop the soil of the farmyard."
column5: "During the Turkey Holocaust (this is what the animal kingdom calls Thanksgiving - they have really short memories and thus don't recall that it actually happens every single year), turkeys are killed en masse, and their bodies are piled high. To keep them from tumbling down, a pile of dirt is piled high right next to them to keep them standing upright so that they will be fresh when it is time to eat them."

column4: "As they constructed the visiting team dugout, they removed a quantity of soil when there was an overpowering stench. Nobody will want to use this dugout!"
column5: A DUGOUT is a dry moat found around Japanese castles. The SOIL is arranged so as to OVERPOWER (or give the advantage to OVERPOWER) an attacking army. If dug in a low lying area it fills with water and becomes a moat (濠 moat (#2306)).

column4: Big consternation in the court! A little bit of soil in the garden touched the empress' face and left a blemish there. Courtiers fainted left and right...
column5: The empress gets a soil mask at the spa to treat a blemish.

column4: I'm usually flat on the soil passed out at nightbreak.
column5: "When the soil is flat, you can see the sun rise over the horizon from a long distance."

column4: "He came to finding himself down at the wharf with soil all over his tuxedo. The maestro can only guess that he'd been drugged by some needle sharp dart, since the last thing that he recalled was feeling a prick on the bottom, before waking up at the wharf."
column5: Note: Right side 阜 is large hill (#2928).

column4: "In a hole in the ground, the body of the victim was placed. And then the killer stuffed it up so that the truth would not be found out, he hoped."
column5: I stuffed up his mouth with dirt to keep the truth from coming out.

column4: "Soil, box, sun, woman: In Peru, they were constructing a dam and to this end, soil was gathered from the surrounds. During the excavations, they found a box, containing little statue of the sun woman (godess). A nice archeological find, but detrimental for the dam building efforts, since the work was to be halted."
column5: "All the dams were built by the Army Corps of Engineers' Ladies' Auxiliary. So the WOMEN worked under the SUN all day, with a BOX full of DIRT on their shoulders, to & fro, building up the dirt wall that would become this mighty dam."

column4: A railing prevents museum patrons from getting soil on the voodoo dolls.
column5: I was relieved to find my stolen lovedoll tied to some railing. She's a bit dirty but still good!

column4: The woman removes the two shells covering her breasts (for modesty) and then attaches the suckling infant. How very Little Mermaid...
column5: I see this as two suckling infants clamped onto their mother (woman) like shellfish when breastfeeding.

column4: Many women violate me at the same time. Then I woke up.
column5: "To avoid being violated, three women cluster together in the women-only wagon of the train."

column4: "The jealous woman bashed the brains in of the guy who betrayed her, with a stone."
column5: Every woman wants a huge stone on her finger to make her friends jealous.

column4: "Handmaiden's are usually quite lowly women, but this one is a special (just look at the way lowly is drawn)."
column5: A handmaiden is a woman servant with the lowly job of burning pirated Chinese DVDs (rough copies of already lowly movies) http://technology.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/tech_and_web/article6730463.ece.

column4: "To become well finished, young women often go to a finishing school at a posh address."
column5: "When asking a girl out on a date, you are only well finished when you have her address and phone number."

column4: "Harlots are women who make a lot of money, usually, so they or their pimps are quite prosperous. Look at all her bling bling, shining like more than two suns. Who says vice doesn't pay?"
column5: Harlots are women who make a living selling themselves to prosperous men.

column4: "In the 平安時代（へいあんじだい）, the courtesans (women who lived in the royal courts) often stayed in the side portions of the palaces, the section that branched off the main building. Idea taken from illustrations in a copy of the Tale of Genji."
column5: "To be a successful courtesan, a woman must be able to branch out into many of the arts."

column4: The photographer took a picture of this fair woman framed by ivy.
column5: "Come on, think of Rapunzel. That WOMAN was so FAIR, she was locked away. Only she used her IVY like FAIR hair to let her lover climb to her."

column4: "Little did you know, the woman who made you climax was your niece."
column5: "My niece is a WOMAN now, and can make herself CLIMAX."

column4: If you go through women rapidly you will be the object of envy.
column5: "Ah, puberty ... the girl that starts her journey towards womanhood the most rapidly will become the subject of envy from all her classmates."

column4: "As any servant knows, a mistress who runs things well must be nature be a very demanding woman."
column5: It is normally the woman who does the job around the home. A mistress is highly demanding. You can see her bossing her family around to do the chores while she does her leisure activities. Looks like she's doesn't have to be bossed to do anything.

column4: The woman version of an old man is an aged woman.
column5: You know an aged woman?! I know an old man. We should set them up. (Note: Be careful not to confuse with old woman (#804)).

column4: "According to Japanese traditions, daughters-in-law have to pay respect to the woman who is their mother-in-law, because they are older."
column5: My mother-in-law is the OLDER version of my WOMAN on the left.

column4: A young miss in a rich Japanese household is often treated with such care that she is a like a woman who is put on a shelf like an ornament.
column5: The young miss won a long of baby beauty pageants. A whole shelf is devoted to the prices she won.

column4: "Finally, I got a woman ... I have to just shriek and rejoice, I'm so overjoyed!"
column5: Men simply rejoice. Women tend to take their emotions a bit further and become overjoyed.

column4: "A woman says to me “I’m expecting – there’s a child in here (pointing to her stomach)” I put my ear to her stomach and suddenly the child punches me – I see the shape of its fist in the stomach wall. “Well, you might be expecting, but I certainly wasn’t expecting that” I reply."
column5: "Fist, child: The guy had only put his fist inside and now his girlfriend is expecting a child. ""How long ago did I have that business trip?"", he wonders."

column4: "Well, yeah, the kid's assiduous: he's got that taskmaster on his back all the time! What else would you expect?"
column5: Assiduous children make assiduous taskmasters.

column4: "It really soothes my mind that I possess a house. Now at least all my payments are going towards something solid, instead of just throwing it away as rent."
column5: "My house is possessed by the ghost of Barry White, who often sings me songs to soothe me to sleep at night."

column4: "When you see Jiminy Cricket near a house, it will imply that Pinocchio isn't far off."
column5: "The talking cricket says, ""you've been spending a lot of time in the house lately,"" and you say, ""What is that supposed to mean?"", to which the cricket replies, ""I'm implying you need to get a job!""."

column4: "During an extensive search of a murderer's house of horror, homocide detectives found an elbow body part by the side of another body. Surely there were even more victims than they imagined."
column5: "Thanks to Katsuo: BY ONE'S SIDE and ELBOW can be SUPERMAN (think of the George Reeve's SUPERMAN pose for a mental image). Well, that fortress of solitude is very EXTENSIVE. Would you expect SUPERMAN's HOUSE to anything less?"

column4: "For a cow used to free-grazing, being stuck in a house is equivalent to being in jail."
column5: "Looking at the kanji 家, keeping pigs in the house was normal. But, if you instead kept a cow in the house, you would be sent to jail."

column4: The A/C wasn't making the house cold because the filters had been blocked up with dirt.
column5: "It was so cold (#1526), the pipes blocked up with ice. After removing the ice, we insulated them with soil."

column4: The Sung dynasty was so-called because people kept trees in their houses and as a consequence birds sung in them.
column5: The Sung dynasty needed to cut down a lot of TREES to make a lot of HOUSES. (the imperial dynasty of China from 960 to 1279; noted for art and literature and philosophy).

column4: "I was once served venison at home, but the only way I could eat it was to down a six pack first."
column5: "I told my friend the deer I kept in my house for venison was called ""roku"" (six). He asked if naming it didn't make me attached to it. I said no, because ""roku"" is also a way to say the kanji for deer."

column4: Chucky from Child's Play was found butchering a poor victim with a flag pole.
column5: Generals usually see their soldiers as mere puppets in their war game. These poor sods are given a flag and told to fight for their country. As if that would make good all the butchering.

column4: "You haven't smelled a fart like his! His were so bad, that when he cut one, they had to wave a flag to keep folks away. None compare to the farts that he farts."
column5: At a fart contest each contestant holds up a flag whenever they fart so the judges can come over and compare it to the others.

column4: "You aren't supposed to throw an American flag out with the rubbish. The proper way to get rid of a flag is to burn it, shown here by holding a candle underneath it."
column5: 尸ee a little on some body if you think they are rubbish.

column4: The baseball team stick flags in their buttocks and wave them at the opposing team to put them off.
column5: I wonder if this story will be flagged for saying i give her buttocks a score of 9.

column4: A Japanese woman walking around waving an American flag probably sleeps with foreigners frequently.
column5: Imagine the flag of Japan. I frequently go there for its tasty rice and to see its beautiful women.

column4: "After meeting death, a flag covers the soldier's corpse."
column5: Imagine the character Death (the shroud-wearing skeleton) carrying an armful of flags. He goes round at night sticking a flag in each corpse. (i.e. to distinguish it from those who are merely sleeping).

column4: "This folding screen looks quite pretty, with all the national flags printed on it, but folding and unfolding it is rather complicated. It looks more like a puzzle than a utility item."
column5: "Someone took an old fence (#1056), brushed the dirt off it and turned it into a folding screen."

column4: "High-reaching aspirations usually revolve around the mountain that is the tallest. For climbing, for descending, for just bring there - the thrill of it all."
column5: "People like Sir Edmund Hillary set very high-reaching goals, like being the first to climb Everest, the tallest mountain in the world."

column4: "The next step on the sentient rice-seedlings; journey, after their miraculous pull through (#2136) from being trapped: mountains in the distance, extremely rugged mountains, and nowhere to go next but through them."
column5: When trying to cross RUGGED MOUNTAINS you'll feel like you have RICE SEEDLINGS for WALKING LEGS.

column4: "In this local folklore, the high mountain has a big ego for being the highest mountain and is therefore rather unkind to people who dare to climb it."
column5: "A drugged up high mountain. Those mountains that get high only think of themselves, their ego takes over. Drugs are a selfish pasttime."

column4: "Standing at the base of the bluffs I announce, ""I'm going to climb those ivy-covered cliffs, and then the mountain on top of them."" My friends don't believe me, ""He bluffs!"" they say."
column5: The ivy-covered cliff we saw on the horizon (#157) ... the sheer beauty of the mountain that overlooks these bluffs is enough to make you want to swim for shore yourself!

column4: "This mountain lies exactly between two prefectures, so naturally there was a struggle about which prefecture had jurisdiction there. And would you believe it, one of them gained jurisdiction over the base, and the other over the mountaintop."
column5: "At the top of the mountain, Bill Clinton found an intern and said ""This mountaintop is my jurisdiction (#1405). I order you to give me head."" The intern replied, ""Come on Bill, hasn't this type of behaviour caused enough problems already?""."

column4: No way that sweet girl can fit those mountains of hers into an A-cup. They'll be severely lacking space. Too many sweets I guess.
column5: "(from mantixen's) I was going to take some sweets on my climb up the mountain, but it wouldn't fit into my bag, so I lack them."

column4: "This is a very rocky mountain! In fact, it has the distinction of being one of the most rocky in the country."
column5: The Rocky MOUNTAINS have the distinction (#554) of being the rockiest MOUNTAIN range.

column4: "The fortune teller tells me that in the future I will have my own quire. ""Is that choir as in 'group of singers', or quire as in 'sheets of paper'?"" I ask. She can't tell because her crystal ball is too misty, so I rush to the bathroom, grab a towel, and use it to wipe the crystal ball. Turns out to be quire as in 'sheets of paper', of course."
column5: "(25 sheets of paper) -- the fortune teller orders a quire of paper but receives a quire of towels. She calls to complain, but customer service tells her, ""Why didn't you see it coming?""."

column4: "My favorite towel is one that says ""Who wants a turn?"" like its an advertising banner."
column5: "When I go to gaming conventions, I always bring my banner: a simple towel with the dice logo on it. Let's roll!"

column4: Many towels were waved and kazoos blown when the Cardinals won the pennant.
column5: "Yep, it's a party alright. The kazoo fiesta noise is audible from far away, and look, they fashioned pennants out of towels to use as a signal flag for beckoning visitors in."

column4: The cleaver was found with the dismembered body wrapped up in a cave.
column5: "The murder victim was killed by a a cleaver. Her body was found in a cave, wrapped up in plastic."

column4: "The very special tall child whom the city folks keep enclosed in their city walls has finally been granted the use of an abandoned cave for his licensed quarters. Hey, its better than sleeping in the open!"
column5: "Meanings acc. to kanji dictionary: enclosure, quarter, large, empty, red-light district)//This city's red light district can be found in tall caves within the city walls. There the prostitutes have licensed quarters to sell their bodies."

column4: "This overhang is really good against the warmth. Compared with other overhangs, this one makes you feel as cool as if you are in a cave."
column5: This overhang has so much shade it's comparable to being in a cave.

column4: "Those wild goose scurry into the caves that have been worn into the side of the cliffs, all trying to avoid a hawk. The bird storming down on them for an easy feed."
column5: "CAREFUL: wild goose (#2150) contains ""cliff"", here we have ""CAVE""!"

column4: "In the Shire, hobbits used to live in caves. Nowadays their holes in the soil still look a little like caves."
column5: "Remember at the end of the Lord of the Rings, when Saruman was found in the Shire trying to fill up all the hobbit's caves with soil? Or something like that."

column4: "With few visitors, the tomb sanctuary in the cave is only open in the morning."
column5: The tomb sanctuary of the Egyptian pharaohs is only open in the morning. At night they seal the cave to keep the spirits from escaping!

column4: "If you can't pull your bow all the way back, you need to strengthen yourself by eating a stack of pancakes and waffles."
column5: I strengthened my bow skills by eating a double decker rice sandwich.

column4: The bow dug more and more into the small of his back as he reclined on it. Will someone please tell the idiot to get up?
column5: "If I recline back, I can pull my bow open a little more and more."

column4: The scorpion nibbled on the string of my bow and loosened it. Now I have to string the bow again!
column5: "My grip on the bow loosened, and I felt myself slowly slipping away. The last thing I remember seeing was the scorpion quietly scuttling away from my trouser leg, where it has delivered it's poisionous blow."

column4: Rice gruel gives you the strength to use two bows at once.
column5: "Kill me now with 2 BOWS, I'm sick of eating RICE gruel."

column4: "To stop workers losing fingers on the lathes, the company has decided to issue lucky rabbit's feet to its workers."
column5: RABBIT FINGERS are also lucky - you can remove them from a RABBIT by using a LATHE.

column4: If you bump into a juvenile he is bound to give you the finger.
column5: "Juveniles are often unsure of how long their extremities actually are, because they're growing all the time. They often bump into things because their fingers are a centimetre or two longer than the last time they looked!"

column4: """How do you like my disguise?"" ""Umm... the fingers are only part of a disguise. You should really disguise the other parts of your body, too.. o.o"" (Imagine the guy is just wearing camouflage gloves or something along those lines.)."
column5: """Now part your fingers, and witness my latest disguise"" It might just work, your friend now appears completely invisible!"

column4: Taking everything in the capital you can get your fingers on.
column5: "Think rape and pillage. The capital has been raided, and the women are all being forcibly fingered."

column4: "In the busy pub, one of the dart players shoved his dart into my elbow by accident when it nearly slipped out of his fingers."
column5: "Your fingers slip when someone's elbow shoves you, causing you to drop the dart you were about to throw. But as you can see, their elbow is very small, so you decide they're too weak to shove back."

column4: "Reminds me of a Star Wars quote, Leia: ""The more you tighten your grip, Tarkin, the more star systems will slip through your fingers."" (i.e., the tighter you clutch, the more countries you'll lose)."
column5: "In countries such as Japan and Australia, the clutch is operated by using the fingers on the left."

column4: "In Nara, they do not accept はんこ, in fact their seals are done by simply impressing fingers into hot melting wax (fingerprints are unique!)."
column5: "In Nara, you impress wax seals with just your finger."

column4: "Ever try WRENCHING a bolt with just your FINGERS? Trust me, you'll WISH you had a wrench for WRENCHING to save your FINGERS."
column5: I have an unfortunate habit of wrenching off other people’s fingers when I pull a wishbone with them.

column4: Insects on your crotch make your fingers want to scratch.
column5: "Scratching with your fingers is a possible sign of a 蚤 flea (#2681) infestation. Even when they (the drops) are gone, the urge to scratch remains."

column4: You reach into a bag of assorted lollies with your fingers and pull out two snakes stuck together.
column5: "You can always find something from his assortment of stolen watches. Fingers, the thief, can pull back his sleeve and allow you to elect (without the road work) any of the watches from his extensive assortment."

column4: Why carry a handkerchief? I wipe my nose finger-style.
column5: "If you are going to wipe your nose with your fingers, better do it in a grand style."

column4: You finally mustered up enough courage to point your finger at the bully in front of you and tell him what an *** he is. Hope you can run fast.
column5: "When I muster up the strength to do something exercise-ish, I have me fingers out in front of me and do the usual stretches. Cracking the knucles and such..."

column4: "If you deal with the Yakuza, you might get a finger separated."
column5: """I'll deal with you separately,"" said the teacher, pointing his finger."

column4: My stomach starts to churn up if I try to count on my fingers how many kanji I still have to memorize.
column5: "This kanji means churn up in the sense of throw into confusion. Picture using your finger to try to draw this kanji on your hand and not being able to remember, just throwing yourself further into confusion."

column4: Think of Braille – rubbing things with your fingers in order to learn.
column5: "I learned, quite by accident, that by rubbing my fingers somewhere special, I felt great. 20 lears later, I'm still rubbing."

column4: Think of shiatsu. You press down on someone with your fingers to help them relax.
column5: You help your girlfriend relax by pressing down on her back with your fingers.

column4: I felt a finger on my leg as someone tried to nab my wallet.
column5: "Fingers nabs Davy Jone's wooden leg: Argh! Bring me back me leg, ya scurvy dog!"

column4: "The old lady said that there was a flood imminent, because her fingers hurt in the evening."
column5: The Dutch boy put his finger in the dam holding back imminent danger from flood waters until evening.

column4: "I'm all used up for the day, so I disseminate turns to the remaining ladies with my fingers."
column5: "Means ""plant; sow"" When sowing seeds or planting flowers, the results will turn out better if you disseminate the seeds/plants with your FINGERS in TURN . A red flower here, then a blue flower, a red flower, then a blue flower, etc..."

column4: "For deaf people, whose ears do not function properly, the interpretation of speech is often attained by using their fingers in sign language, and pay close attention to the mouths of others."
column5: "I bow with hands clasped, my fingers holding the microphone (with an opening that's like an ear for receiving sound) after giving my own interpretation of the karaoke song."

column4: "Why are you holding that lock of hair, man? Are your fingers even clean? Go put that thing into a trash receptacle. No! Not your fingers, the lock. Receptacle seems to work...especially since receptable isn't a word."
column5: "The keyword in the book is ""receptacle"" (which is an actual word unlike receptable). I picture a kidnapping demand where a finger and a lock of hair of the victim is placed into a receptacle and sent to the family."

column4: "DEVOTE (new rtk3 keyword). Think of the Yakuza. To show their DEVOTION to the clan, they must be DEDICATED enough to cut off their FINGERS if they fail a task."
column5: Dedicated people who dedicate themselves to growing bonsai cornstalkes have to have very fine fingers to work the bonsai cornstalk.

column4: "Bad guys in movies always twirl their moustache with their fingers, and that sort of thing."
column5: Twirling a baton is the sort of thing you only do with your fingertips.

column4: The courts use their fingers as a counter for tools used in murder cases.
column5: "A lawyer holds several blood stained screwdrivers in his fingers and asks,""Ladies and gentlemen of the court, how many tools do you see?""."

column4: "A new dance, called the ""commotion"" where you move your fingers in a melancholy way. (Derived from ""The Locomotion"": Everybody's doin' a brand new dance now, Come on baby, do the Locomotion.)."
column5: There was a huge commotion in the state of Denmark when Hamlet cut off his fingers. He must have been really melancholic...

column4: """Come on people, the only way to make headway in this business is to let your fingers do the walking!"" bust out the yellow pages and dial as many numbers as possible, surely someone is a sucker for a cold call sell."
column5: "Thing from the Addams Family has difficulties in making headway because, well, he has no head. Only walking fingers."

column4: "I was petting my pet, but when I looked at my fingers I saw . . . nothingness – my pet had bitten them off."
column5: I pet my pet with my fingers so hard... he was reduced to nothingness.

column4: Use your fingers to scatter sprinkles on top of your ice cream cone まく.
column5: Japanese tradition of 豆撒き（まめまき） - I see a garden sprinkler scattering fingers.

column4: "My turkey suit, complete with actual feathers, was so outstanding that farmers tried to hunt me down with hatchets: I promptly gave them the finger."
column5: "His turkey costume was really outstanding: it was full of real turkey feathers, and he even managed to make convincing bird claws of his fingers."

column4: "Someone tries to lay their fingers on your spoils, and you run after them hitting them with a broom as they run from you."
column5: As my share of the spoils of war I grab a running-broom that has fingers (just like the one in Disney/Mickey Mouse/Fantasia). It runs round cleaning up with its broom and uses its fingers to press buttons etc and operate household appliances. But also like Mickey’s it gets out of control and spoils everything it touches. So much for the spoils of war.

column4: The penalty for gouging out someone's eyes is to have your fingers guillotined.
column5: "Before they guillotine him they gouge out his eyes with their fingers, which is why we can't see eyes in this Kanji."

column4: The gambling addict's state of mind ... wincing as he realizes that everything he owns is gone.
column5: "As they pull the batteries out of Data, we see him wince and then he's gone."

column4: "Brain: ""I'm in a lucid state of mind. Pinky, are you pondering what I'm pondering?"" Pinky: ""Yes Brain, but how are we going to get the turkey up here?""."
column5: The state of mind of a turkey is to ponder the meaning of life while waiting to be eaten come November.

column4: Infatuation is the state of mind that makes a knot form in your heart.
column5: Data instantaneously (#2431)忽 combusted when he first experienced infatuation.

column4: The commando team under orders need to be quickwitted and are always in the right state of mind for action.
column5: "Data, orders: Commander Data is as quickwitted as they come. While Picard is still in the process of uttering an order, Data is already executing it!"

column4: "The state of mind of the tall child whom receives all of the attention is often surprisingly considerate. They have known nothing but kindness in their life, and thus act the same in return!"
column5: A considerate state of mind is open to receive others' input.

column4: A paedophile's state of mind is to yearn for juveniles.
column5: "A juvenile's state of mind tends to go apeshit when they see something they yearn for. Usually involving jumping up and down, tantrums, and other bullshit. (Imagine giving them a big backhand across the face.)."

column4: "I was in a state of mind to ask my wife if some slinky outfit from the closet fit her. ""As if!"" she yelled, ""that belonged to your previous girlfriend!""."
column5: "If your state of mind is fit, it's as if the kanji learn themselves."

column4: He was in a terrible state of mind when his home that he was enlarging was consumed by a fire and everything he had build up was turned to ashes.
column5: "Imagine the state of mind of a person who takes some viagra, thinking it will enlarge his package, but somehow it reduces it to ashes instead."

column4: "The state of mind of a younger brother has respect for elders, including you if you're the elder brother."
column5: "Data, younger brother: Commander Data had a younger, amoral brother (Lore). When they visited an old computer museum, Lore remarked that he could compute much faster than the machines on exhibition. That's when Data found it to be his duty to teach his brother respect for elders."

column4: "The courageous man who went into the water to save a drowning victim couldn't be seen, except by the air that bubbled up."
column5: Bubble up the WATER and see who has the COURAGE to jump into it.

column4: The canals on Mars contain zero water.
column5: A canal is used to put water where there was zero.

column4: Rays of sunlight on the water make for a glistening effect.
column5: "Compare with shimmering (frame 2880), where the rays of sunlight shimmer off the futon. Water is what's glistening in those rays. (helps to remember both kanji)."

column4: "You know you are deep in the water of a bounding main (deep body of water), when you look up and can no longer see the rays of the sun above you."
column5: "In calm waters, even the bounding main is limpid (#2446)晃."

column4: "To gargle, put a bundle of medicine in your mouth with water and throw your head back as if in a yawn."
column5: Gargle with salt water and bundle up if you have a sore thoat and lack medicine.

column4: "Australia is the only continent that is surrounded by water on all sides, yet is still a single state."
column5: "If the borders of a state are all water, then it is more properly called a 'continent' instead. (For 州 state (#128), I think of the small-dash/big-dash alternating pattern that is used for state borders on some maps.)."

column4: "For ten days, we watched the swirling waters, but it didn't seem like the water would rise in another tsunami."
column5: "You have got a really, really plugged up bathtub - so plugged up, as a matter of fact, that when you get out of the bath, it takes an entire decameron for the gently swirling waters to go all the way down. You are really annoyed at this (it's gross, besides), so you get a tiny little sun and bound it up with twine, and lower it into the drain. It clears the clog right up, and the swirling waters zip right on down!"

column4: "We have a prettily shaped umbrella, but when it started to rain, water seeped through and three of our elbows got wet. So much for design over functionality."
column5: "X-men movie scene where the senator SEEPS through the bars like WATER. You see all these ELBOWS (three of them) move in trying to grab him, but it's MYSTIQUE the SHAPE changer that catches him in her UMBRELLA."

column4: "In the wild west everything was so dirty! With the limited water people could spare, a simple rinse was the best your clothes would get."
column5: Rinse empty whiskey bottles with water.

column4: "In the forest fire, they doused the trees with water to prevent more damage."
column5: "You use water to irrigate (#2079) saplings. When it has become a tree, you need more. Then you have to douse it."

column4: Water drops from your eye are teardrops.
column5: "泪橋 teardrops (#2294) ルイ, なみだ ... Parts: 氵, 目 ... Note: Tuttle 3a9.21 ... 涙tears (#1082), vs. 泪teardrops (#2294) (vs 淚 )? don't worry. They are the exact same word except when used in place names: On and Kun are the same . 涕 has the decency to have a different On-Yomi. But the Kun is the same. ..."

column4: "As the Pharaoh's chariots tried to cross the Red Sea, gushing waters came and crushed them."
column5: Picture yourself driving a chariot wildly down the street and knocking over all the fire hydrants. Water is gushing everywhere.

column4: "Wet sand is simply sand but to see beautiful grains of sand, the water must be few."
column5: Near the water is one of the few places you will find grains of sand.

column4: "The church is selling holy water for the faithful, but if you dare to say its tap water, they'd tell you you were blaspheming."
column5: "During the Wedding at Cana, the Son of God had some people come up to complain after he performed his miracle. ""This wine is terrible! Are you trying to sell me watered-down wine?"" He replied, ""It's a wedding, for God's sake, the wine is free, so stop complaining."" The dissatisfied guest retorted, ""Hey, don't blaspheme!"" Jesus Christ just rolled his eyes and, under his breath, uttered his own name in vain."

column4: "The vulture is on top of the porter and appears to be commiting a lewd act, so I throw water over the pair of them."
column5: Claw marks across the porters back from engaging in lewd acts in the shower. He is tipped well for carrying the lady's bags to her room.

column4: What seemed to be water dripping from the wooden roofbeam was actually drops of blood dripping from a sword lodged in it.
column5: "He cut down the tree with a sword to make a new roofbeam, but when he saw two drops lying on the tree, he assumed there was too much water in the wood and he left it to dry first."

column4: "Mr. President is visiting the city of New Orleans, where the sediment is being cleared away that got there when the water rushed in during hurricane Katrina."
column5: "After Mr. (and Mrs.) Smith blasted everything in sight with a missile launcher (see Mr. (#1805)), turning the whole world into sediment, nothing was left to shot at. The only thing left was WATER. So boring..."

column4: It's a widespread belief that they cannot find fingerprints on a body that has been deposited in the water.
column5: It's a widespread belief that water takes away fingerprints.

column4: "Old Kyoto was once the capital, but if has fallen from grace and the flowers that used to decorate its houses have all disapeared."
column5: Each drop of water has been through old Kyoto at some point.

column4: "One of the modern commandments: ""Thou shalt not imagine wet women, dripping in their bathing suits""."
column5: """O Romeo, Romeo, wherefore art thou Romeo?"" says Juliet, her eyes all watery."

column4: "I filter my water using a deer. Sure I'm a naturalist, but you know what? The filtered yellow ""water"" tastes MUCH better!"
column5: "When you go out into the wilderness, you shouldn't drink fresh water no matter how clean and clear it looks. A deer could have just crapped in it a mile upstream. Lesson: Bring some kind of filter to filter your drinking water."

column4: Water dripping repeatedly on someone is enough to put them on the verge of insanity.
column5: I was on the verge of wetting myself when she repeatedly showed me her...

column4: A moat is a water structure used against something potentially overpowering.
column5: "Australia was designed as a moat, surrounded by water, to keep out the overpowering forces of foreign nations."

column4: "If you discharge a water gun, it sprays water of course!"
column5: "To spray is to have water discharged, from, for example, a hose."

column4: Weak people placed in the water start drowning. Get some strength in those arms and learn how to swim!
column5: Weak swimmers drowning in the water.

column4: They started playing music when the ship of the emperor came in sight over the water and was brought into port.
column5: A band playing music on the water front for a heroic Navy ship returning to port.

column4: "Picture yourself living in solitude on a tiny island. There are only two trees, and you keep getting splashed by water from sea waves."
column5: A water-filled grove is a place of solitude.

column4: "According to the book of revelations, abounding waters will be the first sign of the apocalypse!"
column5: Revelations into the benefits of drinking water are abounding these days.

column4: These spikes mark the water's edge in ancient times. Notice that the water level is actually much lower today.
column5: The water's edge is firmly nailed to the ground with robust spikes... through the water.

column4: A bird often found near creeks is the large goose.
column5: Ever ridden in a watercraft at an amusement park in the shape of a large goose bird?

column4: "When the pegasus attacked, we did what we could and soused it: everyone knows that a wet pegasus is a dead pegasus."
column5: "Souse the pegasus with water, she likes it."

column4: "Water is to the benefit of all live forms, so when a place has a lot of water, you soon see it brimming with life forms."
column5: (+brendanmacdonald) Water is brimming with health benefits!

column4: "I couldn't find any reference to this kanji as meaning cleanse. It seems to be most often used in the following compound 沙汰（さた）to mean affair. The other meanings seem to be closer to 'select' so maybe Heisig meant cleanse in the ethnic sense here.. I'm going to use the keyword ""selection"", as in natural selection. Story: natural selection first began in the water, and those that were too plump were selected out."
column5: Water is used to cleanse a plump man's colon.

column4: A tremendous amount of people inundate waterparks during summer vacation.
column5: "After the success of Gatorade, Michael Jordan was inundated with requests to do water commercials."

column4: "I doubt it was an immaculate conception, I'm sure she received something 'watery' from someone or other."
column5: Water you receive as a gift should be immaculate.

column4: "...Faramir and Frodo watched the tiny creature far below. ""Shall we shoot him?"" Faramir asked. ""This Gollum has defiled the waters of the Forbidden pond, looking for his Precious, and for that the penalty is death""..."
column5: Don't defile precious water.

column4: "Before raging wildfires approach the town, homeowners will spray hose water on their roof to moisten the house as a preventative measure."
column5: "When it's very dry, I sometimes moisten the wooden beams on the roof with water so that they won't completely dry out and crack open."

column4: Rough seas are a body of water that is most difficult to travel over.
column5: Rough seas = difficult waters.

column4: When you draw water you reach out and take the water from the well.
column5: Reach out for water to draw water from the well.

column4: "Stare into the quiet water of the river pool, and maybe you'll see the river mermaids."
column5: A river pool is a little spot of WATER over on the edge where the water can be QUIET for a while before going back out into the roaring river to flow.

column4: "Water, detain: At the airport, crazy EU customs regulations made that every person carrying water bottles was detained and the water bottles themselves impounded. As you may imagine, in the customs office, there was quite a cumulation of water bottles."
column5: "I look up at a cumulonimbus cloud and say “There must be a lot of water detained in that cumulonimbus, quite a cumulation”."

column4: "Moses threw the golden calf into a nearby abyss, chased the offenders that had worshipped it with a saber, and cleaned the whole spot it had been standing with water as to wash away the sins of these people."
column5: "In the abyss of hell, there is no water and Satan keeps watch with his sabre."

column4: Chaos theory holds that a single EARTHWORM wriggling can cause huge flows of WATER all over the planet.
column5: Earthworms go into chaos when there's no water.

column4: "Yeah, all our water is fairly mediocre, but if we work together in some pan-continental union, we can make some better water! As if."
column5: "This is pan- as in the prefix meaning ""all"". I think of Pangea as being a mediocre continent with water covering the rest of the planet. This was before it broke up into the first-class, well-distributed continents we got now."

column4: "Prudence always splashes water over the strainer before & after using it. ""Just being prudent"", she says."
column5: "The strainer exercises prudence on the water, only letting the good water pass."

column4: Those who demand water will be drenched.
column5: "When he demanded water from the waitress, she dumped the glass over his head, drenching his clothes."

column4: "If you get caught in an eddy, the water seems determined to pull you in."
column5: "An eddy is created when water determines it doesn't want to just ""go with the flow""."

column4: The greatest fabrication ever told was that God made the water and the earth in only one day.
column5: This kanji should mean black soil. It is is used for Buddha's death and nirvana (涅槃 (ねはん)). Story: Fabrication of black soil. Use water to wash away other colours and and dry it in the sun (sun over soil).

column4: Your father uses his legs to stop himself from being put in a metal cauldron.
column5: "Whilst on holiday, my father was captured by cannibals and put in a metal cauldron."

column4: "Father is sitting on top of an axe, and when I ask why he says, “Axe? It’s a hatchet, and I’m trying to hatch it”."
column5: The father axe giving birth to baby hatchets. There is a role reversal in axe families.

column4: Father!!! My Father exclaimed when he saw my grandpa again. [exclamation (#2680)].
column5: "My grandpa, the father of my father, often puts his ear agains the city walls to hear what's going on. Well, Alzheimer..."

column4: The sly criminal gave a skeleton to the pack of wild dogs chasing him.
column5: "Sly fox thought he could outsmart the wild dogs, but all they found of him was his skeleton."

column4: The indecent man made even the pack of wild dogs apprehensive (#2569).
column5: "An indecent video featuring a helpless victim taking hairpins in his brain while a pack of wild dogs tears him from limb to limb, has generated calls for compulsory censorship of the internet."

column4: You have to have cunning to mingle with a pack of wild dogs and get away unharmed.
column5: A pack of wild dogs mingle together and perform cunning-lingus.

column4: A raccoon dog joined the pack of wild dogs as their computer-literate otaku member with circles around his eyes.
column5: The racoon dog was only allowed to join the pack of wild dogs because his computer owned.

column4: "I don't know if ""All (wild) dogs go to heaven,"" but I think this wolf will, because he has a halo."
column5: "Pack of wild dogs, halo: In the pack of wild dogs, there is a prophesy. The wild dog that is born with a halo surrounding it will eventually turn into a wolf and lead the pack of wild dogs to victory over mankind."

column4: The pack of dogs got all flustered when they tried to open the shellfish with their snouts.
column5: "The shellfish flustered the fishermen by pretending to be a pack of wild dogs. ""woof woof, grrrrrr""."

column4: "Mother dog: “I don't like our pup hanging around with that pack of wild dogs because he picks up all sorts of bad phrases.” Father dog: “Don't worry, he's only a pup – it's just a phrase he's going through”."
column5: """He encountered a pack of dogs"" sounds like a scary phrase, until you mention they were all puppies."

column4: A pack of dogs chases a fox who has stolen a melon! Must be a vegetarian fox...
column5: "In Japanese folklore the FOX is known for changing shape. This one was being chased by a PACK OF WILD DOGS and passing a garden, changed into a MELON to hide."

column4: From the pack of wild dogs only white ones are chosen to be a-un (to guard the temple).
column5: Lion-like wild dogs that show their white teeth to anyone who approaches the Shinto shrine.

column4: "When her home was invaded by a pack of dogs, the little girl climbed on the shelf and aimed various items at the dogs below."
column5: I think the dogs purposely aim at your shelves to deal the most damage.

column4: "In ""The Lion King,"" Scar was the expert who did all the scheming, and the three hyenas were his pack of wild dogs that did most of the dirty work."
column5: The pack of wild dogs admire the lion as an expert hunter.

column4: "The hunter employs a pack of dogs to hunt baboons, which he sells to zoos for a lot of dollars."
column5: Baboons like to taunt wild dogs by dangling their dollar sign chains from trees just out of their reach (and occasionally mooning them with their red butts).

column4: "If you smoke these tobacco flowers, you'll end up sporting a halo sooner rather than later."
column5: "If you smoke these tobacco flowers, you can blow funky smoke halos (rings)."

column4: "If you know someone called Jasmine, then just imagine yourself sticking a flower in her extremity."
column5: "The jasmine flowers are exceptionally strong scented, and you can smell it the whole day if you rub them on an extremity of your body, like a hand."

column4: "Thanks to Nathaniel Hawthorne, the hawthorn flower is now profitable."
column5: A hawthorn is a flower that stands in the way of profit as it has to be taken out of the wheat fiels by farmers.

column4: "The strawberry plant is one that mothers really like. Not particularly for its flowers, but for the fruit of course, so they can make fresh strawberry pies."
column5: "Most people eat the fruit of the strawberry plant, but your mother eats the flowers."

column4: The bush clover is a special flower which was dedicated to bush when he won the presidency in Autumn.
column5: Bush clover flowers in autumn.

column4: "Its the oldest technique in the book. When surrounded by the evil rice seedling forces (they have gathered all around the ground around you), you dispense a cloud of rising smoke from your feet, and disappear, leaving only flowers behind."
column5: The [old] technique for making a rising cloud of flowers was misused by round men to get a woman's legs caught in ivy.

column4: Get a pheasant (#2584) to trim your flowers for you.
column5: Pheasant 雉 under glass with flower trimmings as garnish. Mmmm!

column4: "Looking for a job at a florist during bad weather, I was forced to wear my pauper's straw raincoat. Predictably, I was declined at every flower shop I found."
column5: "Flower, decline: After your flowers have declined (i.e., lost their bloom), you can always use the remains to weave a straw raincoat. It's all about recycling these days..."

column4: "Oh, the committee's in for a surprise: I put some nightshades into their drinks. They'll be numb for sure, probably worse."
column5: "The keyword numb makes no sense. I choose 萎む（しぼむ）""to fade away"". A girl lies in a wheat field at the same time every day. A photo is taken every day showing this scene and a time lapse video shows the wheat growing through the year until the wheat is tall and the top sprouts to look like its flowers. At this point, the girl can no longer be seen in the photos and she fades away."

column4: Flowers can be seen on the pedestal covered with moss.
column5: The flowers you can see on old pedestals when you visit the ruins in Greece are moss in fact.

column4: "When the prodigal son returned, he was greeted with flowers and hot water for tea by his mum."
column5: "The prodigal son thought he was going to be in hot water when he went home after wasting his family's money, but instead they greeted him with flowers."

column4: You cover over the shredder with flowers when the FBI comes a-knockin'.
column5: The taskmaster arranges flowers to cover over the rags she makes us clean with.

column4: The alien plant from outer space flowered and started drawing mandala's on the ground with its tendrils as a way of communication.
column5: If you show a mandala to a flower it will cross its tendrils into the lotus position.

column4: "A lotus can either be a flower, or else something that takes you along (the car make)."
column5: "Way too easy! Lotus, as in the really expensive, fast car. Whenever I want to take someone somewhere (連れる）, I make sure to rent a Lotus so that I can arrive to pick them up in style. I'm a great customer of the local car rental shop, so they always make sure to give me a flower when I pick up my Lotus."

column4: "[+woelpad] In a certain culture, there is a ritual carried out when a girl is quite young (young enough, in fact, that they do it before they are considered a woman in that culture - for the same reason that some cultures do not name a baby until they are sure it will live) - she must go on a vision quest for a lotus flower and look inside it to see the face of her husband - then report back.. Imagine a poor flower girl's dismay when she looks into the lotus flower and sees the face of Homer Simpson!."
column5: There's a popular myth amongst flower girls that the face of their future husband is hidden inside a lotus flower.

column4: Those little flower buds contain a whole lotus blossom when they grow bigger.
column5: "Flower, contain: 'Lotus Blossom' is the stripped down version of a software package tailored to the needs of flourists: Lotus Flower (lotus flower (#2361)). However, the software still contains the most important functionality of the original version."

column4: "The orchid thief tries to steal exotic flowers from the east, only to be stopped customs at the departure gate * 蘭 【らん】orchid."
column5: The Asian lesbians are partial to this flower because it reminds them of their favorite classic video game character: B. Orchid.

column4: "You must play a tune using a hollow reed, to open the secret door hidden beneath the flowers."
column5: "Ancient superstition requirs you to adorn your door with hollow reed and flowers, but nobody knows the purpose anymore."

column4: "The signature flower of Ireland: the yam! Speaking of which, how are yams different from potatoes?"
column5: A yam has a signature flower that differentiates it from a sweet potato.

column4: Only prosperous people (picture someone with a lot of bling) can afford to have iris flowers in the house regularly. They're too expensive for daily use.
column5: "You become so prosperous selling flowers (irises) you buy Van Gogh's famous painting ""Irises"" and hang in in your flower shop."

column4: "Like the fruit itself, banana flowers look charred as they age."
column5: Charred bananas on a bed of flowers are a delicacy that stir up images of a tropic island.

column4: "My favorite are heart shaped candles that smell like sweet flowers. The trick is to find one with a thick wick, they give off the most flower scent (but burn the quickest)."
column5: Giving a girl flowers is like lighting the wick to her heart.

column4: """Buckwheat's been shot! Buckwheat's been shot!"" At his funeral, attended by the rest of Our Gang, Buckwheat is placed in his coffin covered by flowers. An angel is also present, and says ""Its O-tay Buckwheat, you have been invited up to heaven!""."
column5: Grain from the buckwheat plant can be used for some angelically tasting cakes.

column4: Butterbur flowers can be seen along the path.
column5: "A Butterbur is a plant, but also, in LOTR, Butterbur is the name of the owner of the Prancing Pony. The hobbits met him on their path to Mount Doom."

column4: Indigo flowers have to be overseen because they are often picked for their beauty.
column5: "Traditionally, 青 blue (#1534) could be used to describe blue OR green. However, two kanji that describe the hues specifically are 藍 and 緑. This kanji is the ""blue"" counterpart of green (#1371). Story: The overseer, master of the slaves, wore a cloak dyed with indigo, and flowers in his hair."

column4: Eggplant is a low カロrie flower (thanks Peppi).
column5: An epplant is a flower with almost no 加ries...

column4: """How many flowers can I stuff in your nostrils? Well I'm just gonna have to go and see."" Bullying at its worst!"
column5: "Flowers, you ask if they can feel pain, do you? ^stomp^ ^stomp^ ^stomp^ They sure -can-!! ^stomp^ ^stomp^ ^stomp^ ^stomp^ ^stomp^ ^stomp^!!"

column4: "Behind the scenes, in the shady areas, they trade various flowers: oh, yeah, gather 'round the good stuff!"
column5: "Another Heisig RTK3 fail. I'm going to use ""owing to"" as the keyword -- it's mostly used in 御蔭で (thanks to you). Thanks to you, I was even able to grow flowers in the shade, no easy task."

column4: "Wormwood brings very, very vivid and hallucinogenic dreams. You eat some of the intoxicating flowers of the wormwood with your girlfriend...and in your high state of mind, decide that it would be a good idea to do it in the bushes on the side of Mario Kart Road. Suddenly, in the middle of it, she starts tripping out, and runs through the bushes into the middle of the track, while they are racing...and is killed. Imagine waking up from that dream...or was it a dream? Sticks for me anyway."
column5: You bring a wormwood flower to a tryst (#2417) for the bitter parting at the end.

column4: Mustard has a lot of flavor jammed in to its flowers.
column5: Mustard is a plant that jams in all its taste into its mustard seeds.

column4: You need a lot of bright light to germinate flowers.
column5: "If there is one thing those nasty german's hate its bright, happy flowers."

column4: "Grapes are totally a conspiracy, I'm telling you. They're pretty little plants with flowers that grow in clusters, and they are sweet, I know, but...Bound up in each little grape (the skin is like a wrapping) is a tiny RFID tag that the government uses to spy on you. That's why they sell them in such large quantities for so cheap - if you ""pass"" a few of them out, no matter - odds are that at least one will stay inside you. They especially push them on kids."
column5: My offspring ate all the grapes off the grape vine (#2379)!

column4: """I heard it through the grape vine""' using a pair of tin cans bound together to form a 糸電話 hidden amongst the flowers."
column5: "I WRAPPED a large tin can (#1965) to a grape vine, under the FLOWERS of the grape vine, so that grapes fall directly into the tin can (#1965) when they are ripe."

column4: Fish are used (as fertilizer) to resurrect your wheat to a flowering state.
column5: Famous resurrection: Jesus. There's the fish and loaves of wheat bread he's got under his arms and flowers in his hair.

column4: "First the flowers grow up, but if you aren't attentive, they have a tendency to grow wild, playing dice out in the garden to kill time. A bad seed, indeed. Flowers grown wild!"
column5: "Some kids playing the board game Jumanji throw the dice, and as a result, flowers suddenly begin to grow wild all around them."

column4: "A truly invasive parasite, the cocklebur is a flower that attaches itself to its namesake and proceeds to order the host around, the poor guy."
column5: "When cocklebur flowers get stuck in your socks and shoelaces while bushwalking, you have to order everyone to stop and wait while you pick them out."

column4: Orphans sleep on the flowers of a rush mat.
column5: "The poor orphans took to injecting 'flowers' (poppy variety), and lay Knocked Out (KO) on the rush mat floor of the orphanage."

column4: "Flower, crown, one, sow: Each year, just before Christmas, one sow is selected among many to wear a crown adorned with flowers.
